Every time I go to San Francisco I HAVE to stop by this park. The location is simply the best part about it. You can't find views any more amazing than the ones you get here. The park itself is huge, and the trail is moderate. 

So why didn't I give this place 5 stars? One crucial reason. Those that have been coming here for years would probably understand and/or agree with me. That reason being THE HORRIBLE RENOVATIONS, or "revitalization" as the city calls it. The park has lost all of its magic and mystique. They've successfully turned it into another tourist trap. I could go on about this forever, but I'm just going to mention a few points: 

-75% of the original plant-life is gone. Huge disappointment.  
-The previous dirt trail has been replaced with a paved one.
-Barriers have been put up so idiots don't fall off the cliffs.
-The many "hidden trails" have been blocked access to.
-Overcrowded with retarded tourists taking pictures.
author: Kev N.

description: There's plenty of parking available and its not much of a hike. Its more like an easy stroll to enjoy the scenery. A lot of tourists, families, and joggers with their dogs come here. The view is beautiful! On a clear day, you can see the Golden Gate bridge. Take the Coastal Trail if you want to see the maze. GO if you haven't! Its a-maze-ing!
author: Jenann P.

description: Absolutely Majestic! Stunning views of the water. Great place to spend the day. The gift shop has amazing chocolate chip cookies.
author: Benjamin L.

description: Beautiful trail and very wonderfully paved. Very good for beginners and for seasoned hikers. One tip - to get to the labyrinth you have to follow signs for Mile Rock Beach and make a left at the fork.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Awesome view. beautiful trails
We went there last week and it was not much crowded on a sunday and weather was perfect .

Shuld u go ? 
Heck ya 

Shld i go even if i hv dogs?
Ofcourse

Shld i go if i dnt luv dogs?
hmm,, bad question No
Trails is dog friendly and dogs will b hvng fun as well
But if ur not comfortable with them ,, thnk about it ,, but ur missing a beautiful trail 

Trail is under repair at the end 
U might want to check that as well

Does it have steps?
Yes in parts,, 
Go there enjoy views and i say climbing steps is worth a watch
author: C S.

description:
I wouldn't really call this a hiking trail, but definitely a nice scenic trail to walk on. Very easy and pretty flat... so if you're a beginner in hiking or just looking for a place to walk your dog... this is the place! The trail is pretty short but lots of trees and greenery to make things look nice. On a clear day you could see the Golden Gate Bridge... on a foggy/cloudy day... well... you see what you see. Can be a bit cold since it's basically Ocean Beach, and its rarely warm in that area. If it's hot and warm there... you can bet the rest of the city is nice and warm too. The only drawback is that dog owners DO NOT CLEAN UP. I'm not sure if it's because of the government shutdown, but even then... it's the owners responsibility to pick up and throw away the dog droppings. On the trail, there was a lot of dog droppings. That or they were bagged but sitting on the road or hanging on a tree like an ornament. At one point I saw dog just squatting and dropping a deuce while the owners kept walking. This place needs more trashcans for owners to drop the poo into or they need workers walking around forcing owners to pick up after themselves.

Other than the poop being everywhere... nice trail to stroll on.
author: Johnson S.

description:
Perfect route if you're in the mood for running a half marathon. Lots of elevation gains and losses, mix of street and asphalt with parks, coast, bay and ocean. At dusk, the changing view of the Golden Gate Bridge will have you coming back and through, time and again. Its sometimes easy to get distracted by otters at Sutro Baths, waves off Kelly's Cove,  the Alamo Square puppies and Golden Gate Park hippies and hipsters but its all part of the experience of Lands End Loop. Be prepared to have your run extended by 15-30 minutes if you're easily distracted.

Sacramento St becomes Lake St as you head west and you'll find a lot of runners along this route. It's mostly straight and sometimes uninterrupted by cars. Somehow, our solid, disorganized group of after work runners have converged and we've thus claimed it as ours. Helps quite a bit as traffic has learned to look out for the gazelle like forms speeding through.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description:
Came here Sunday morning around 10 a.m. on the ocean beach end. There was lots of free parking at this time. There is a pretty new visitor's center next to the parking lot to buy coffee, use the restroom, or buy souvenirs. Weather was mid-60s, no fog or wind, blue skies...and it's late december! Absolutely gorgeous with beautiful views of the golden gate bridge.

There are side trails that go down to the waves off the main trail, which casually winds along the side of the cliffs with constant views of the golden gate bridge. There are lots of trees that provide shade and there are some steps along the way. I saw lots of dogs, a few bikers, people with strollers. It's an easy hike and it took us less than 2 hours to leisurely stroll to the end and back while exploring the side trails. Note there are repairs at the end which the sign said should be completed by the end of December.

Overall, an absolute must-see if you visit SF. It's trails like these that convince people to move to SF.
author: Kevin H.

description: Scenic and picturesque beyond belief. Lush greenery, cool weather, and the brick-red Golden Gate afar off. Best view of SF that I've yet seen, and so refreshing too. Trail is more of a brisk walk than any sort of strenuous hike. Would come back in a heartbeat.
author: Phoebe C.

description: Perfect spot to check the view.  If you are a runner, great place to train.  If you are a lovey dovey couple, you should come here.  Just come here!
author: Brandy C.

description: Great views of the Pacific! I love the labyrinth. Really cool plant life and the cafe was great too. Great view of the Golden Gate. I wish I could come here every day.
author: Lee A.

description:
I love this trail! I can't count the number of times I've walked this trail, which wraps around the the bay and into the pacific ocean, but I'm awed every time by the breathtaking views of the Golden Gate and the ocean. 

It's a moderate trail, though some portions require climbing or descending steps. It's mostly dirt, though the beginning and end parts of the trail are paved. Pretty shady, you'll see a lot of people walking their dogs, and everyone is quite friendly. At the end of the trail if you're heading west, you can find the Sutro Baths, with a small cave on the beach!

Love the photo opportunities!
author: Kevin L.

description: Beautiful trail, and the bath ruins are awesome. Definitely suggest stopping here if you're passing through SF.
author: Jonny S.

description: Easy trail. We started from the Sutro Baths but didn't get to do the whole hike due to construction :( so disappointed. Really not worth coming here until it is complete. Just run up and down the stairs a couple times for a work out ;)
author: Betty C.

description:
I decided to do some exploring one day and find the infamous labyrinth that I've seen in pictures. Boy, did I take the long, hard way! 

To make your trip easiest, here are some tips: 

- Want to see the Sutro Baths also? Park at the lot off of Point Lobos Ave.  
- Want to just walk the Land's End path and most importantly, the labyrinth? Park at the lot off El Camino Del Mar. This is what we did. 
- From El Camino Del Mar lot, there are 2 choices - 1) face the ocean and walk to the right on the dirt path into the tree area. While this seems safe and easy, it quickly gets desolate. In order to get to the labyrinth and see the ocean closer, you have to walk down many many winding stairs. Though this is the route we took, this not my recommendation, as it's harder and views of the ocean are limited by the trees. 
- Instead, from the El Camino Del Mar lot, take the 2nd choice - 2) face the ocean and walk towards a staircase down. Although there are about 40 stairs, it's far less stairs than the other route. The stairs lead to the Coastal Trail and is a nice walk with benches and good views of the ocean.  
- At this point, to the left is heading towards the Sutro Baths and to the right is the Land's End trail and to my goal, the labyrinth. You should head to the right and it will eventually come to a fork in the road with a sign for Coastal Access. Make that left and start taking the stairs down to the ocean. You can either go all the way down and you'll eventually hit an inlet at the ocean level with some logs to sit on and admire the view. Then you have to head upwards a bit and on a narrow path to the labyrinth. 
- If you don't go all the way down to the ocean, you can veer to the right and it leads you directly to the labyrinth. 
- The labyrinth is not on the ocean level but elevated. It is not huge but has a cool view of the Golden Gate Bridge. You can also go to a hill behind it to get a better view of the labyrinth. Walking to the back of the hill is the easiest way to get top of that hill. 

Not sure where you're at? Use the satellite view of Google Maps but try to stay on the Coastal Trail for the best experience.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
this place is so pretty! SO SO SO PRETTY!

Definitely one of those scenic romantic spots you bring your significant other and drop down to one knee and live happily ever after. 

different routes that takes you to different secret spots, for example the maze, is great bonus to this place. 

i cant wait to go back!
author: Christine L.

description:
We drove to Land's End and hiked this trail.  It was fairly easy and enjoyable.  The view during this trail was amazing!  You would get a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge at several viewpoints.  If you are looking for Land's End labyrinth, take the trail to the beach and you will find it.  

This trail is also dog friendly!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
My absolute FAVORITE place to walk/hike/take my dog. 

Everyone is so friendly here and when it's sunny, the views of the bridge are amaazing. 

The steps are difficult if you're out of shape, even if you're in shape, they are challenging, but it is well worth it to walk out and see the view.
author: Alison N.

description:
This hike is extremely rewarding for how little work you put in.
There are lots and lots of people ranging from tourists to your everyday walkers.

It's literally just a little walk maybe some stairs and a little bit of incline but the view trade off is pretty high.

I have done 8 miles up and down hikes (so many hills... oh just so many) that didn't justify its view. But Lands End is enjoyable for young and old alike!
author: Winè C.

description:
My vision was starting to blur, 
the words were blending together, 
I was losing all comprehension. 
The taunting flash of the line
waits for my next tap.
The migraine began,
and I shut my laptop. 

I went to check on the trail, 
The renovation was finally complete. 
The entrance was much more open,
with the Golden Gate Bridge in clear view
no longer obstructed by the shadows
of looming trees. 
A new bench has been installed, 
with a few lonesome
or perhaps tired folks 
not unlike myself. 

I struck the trail
in my horrible flats. 
But the dampened earth
from the morning fog
made it easy to walk on. 
The ocean's lull, 
the hush of the waves
echo through the trail.

The walls of vines
and tress encase me.
Protecting me 
and isolating me 
from the hustle 
that was merely a block away. 

I did not venture all the way to Sutro Baths, 
but this trip to Fresh and Easy
that turned into an hour hike 
was just what I needed.

An oasis. 
Peaceful. 
And so wonderful.
author: Jane T.

description:
Great Hike
Beautiful View
Clear view of the Golden Gate Bridge
author: Vivek S.

description:
LOVE THIS TRAIL! 

Came on a Saturday at 10AM to beat crowds and the blazing afternoon sun, since there's little to no trees to provide shade along the trail. Our timing was optimal, and It turned out to be the perfect hike. Amazing views of the ocean, relaxing trails, and the occasional set of stairs that helped us work out our calves big time. It took us about an hour and a half to walk the entire trail and back. Dogs are welcome and there is plentiful parking. 

A great little getaway from the city while you're still in the city. Will definitely be coming back on the weekends if possible. :)
author: Vivian D.

description:
Quite possibly one of the coolest places in SF!  Even though it's in the city, you feel as though you are hiking on the edge of the world.  Great views of the ocean and Golden Gate await.  It's also cool to see the bridge from this other side, which I find, is rarely viewed.  

It's a fantastic place to relax, exercise and get your nature fix.  The hike is fantastic and in the midddle of it, before you turn back around you can walk throughout the Sea Cliff neighborhood and marvel at the gorgeous houses--including Mr. Robin Williams' home.  Even though the trail is pretty high up from the water, there are certain places where you can walk down stairs to get to the ocean and there you will find (usually) your own private beach.    

Parking in the lot is free and at the trail head.  There is also this extremely cool cave down by the Sutro Baths that you must hit up either before or after you start your hike!
author: Sheryce S.

description: Just hiked yesterday with friends and there are many trails. I had a workout of 3.4 miles.  There were many people there on the trails. Very popular place.  If you like hiking try this trail.
author: Lillian W.

description:
Man, oh man do I love the Bay Area. The trail isn't too long, but it still manages to give you a breathtaking view of the city. The Sutro Baths are remarkable, and the views you can get on top of various hills and rocky cliffs are outstanding! Walk a little further, and you get a delightful view of the Golden Gate Bridge. 

It's typically chilly, so make sure to wear good running/hiking shoes and bring a warm jacket! Overall, this is one of those spots that makes San Francisco my favorite city in the entire world.
author: Crystal J.

description: We ate at the seaside cafe in one of the hotels at the foot of the trail and made our way down to the trail around 9 in the morning. The place was purely mystical among the fog with the tall trees, and seaside air - everything was perfect and calming. The Sutro Baths smelled kind of funky, but it's a great place to stare and reflect on the history behind the place.
author: Anuja S.

description:
Fantastic hike with a plethora of breathtaking views -- enjoy the extravagance of the CA redwoods while giving your canine friend a break from his/her leash, some fresh air to breathe, and many small hills to conquer. 
Also, SF Golden Gate bridge selfie shots galore.
author: Philip B.

description: A great place to hike and if u got a dog, bring him! A truly beautiful trail that that a nature type of feel. The trail is huge and goes through a mountain terrain . Even the trees and view of the Bay. There's a trail that leads down to the beach. YOu can view the Golden Gate Bridge from here. And what i love the most is the parking lot that always has enough space and u dont have to pay for it! here in SF parking can be crazy and frustrating but in this trail, its free and no big deal, a big parking lot for when u enter the trail. So much to say about this trail so please just come check it out for yourself, u will be amazed. Just be careful to not go off the trail, be safe!
author: Stephen C.

description:
Very easy hike. Check the weather before you go cause when we went I thought I was going to get blown over it was so windy. Pretty short hike (3.4 miles) unless you decide to stop and take pictures every 5 seconds like we did. Lots of parking. If the lot is full there is a lot of street parking. I would say this hike is worth it purely for the views...given that it's a clear day. So again, check the weather.

Probably on my top 5 must to do list in SF.
author: Ann P.

description:
So beautiful!  Love the views.

Came with with my dog on a Saturday's Morning.  The weather was so nice on that day.  It was a warm and sunny day.  Therefore a lot of people were there already in the morning.  Parking was pretty easy there.  

The trail was about 2-3 miles long, lot of stairs and hills.  But it was still easy to walk.  The views were so beautiful.  You could see Golden Gate Bridge in different angle......

Overall, I had a great time there.  So relaxing and fun.  I will go back for sure :-)
author: Liza T.

description: I love this trail.  SF usually always has great weather so it makes the hike nice.  Right to the ocean and views of golden gate.  Just beautiful.  I made a rock statue. :)
author: Bryan M.

description:
The Lands End Trail actually makes you feel like you are out of the city and in nature--no small feat in San Francisco.

The hike is pretty easy, with only a few steep stair climbs.  The views are beautiful, and there is plenty to explore.  

QUICK TIP: If you hope to see the beautiful views of the Golden Gate Bridge that this trail offers, make sure you go on a day that isn't cloudy or foggy outside (I know...few and far between in that part of the city, right?).

Even on a foggy day, the views of the ocean; the trees, shrubs, and flowers; and the fun trails and caves to explore make this a great San Francisco getaway.
author: Ben M.

description:
One of our most underrated parks in the city!

From here you can spot ship wreckage during low tide, porpoises frolicking, and sweeping views of the bridge. Joggers use this trail to connect Golden Gate Bridge and the Great American Highway. Look up some info about the ship wreckage and impress your visitors. ;)
author: Aubrey O.

description:
My first trail in the San Francisco area and i was absolutely in love! The view is absolutely gorgeous and just perfect. This trail begins at Presidio Park and ends at a little area before the beach. 

Along the trail, you'll find different paths that goes the Legion of Honor and another little beach. I'm sure there are other paths as well, but those are the only two i was fortunate to see. 

If you decide to come check this out, make sure you check the weather as well. We came on a sunny day but, it was a day after it had rained so it was muddy in a few places. Also, it can get really windy so wear a few layers of clothing unless you're planning to run or jog. And bring your pets!! :)
author: Lisa H.

description: When I  first moved into the city, I never realized there were so many urban hiking locations in SF. I've been here a few times and I really enjoy this hike since it's a little getaway from the city life and you don't have to drive to far if you already live in the city. The place is beautiful with the great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. When I first hiked Land's End back in 2012, my boyfriend and I went early in the morning so we could see the sunrise. We started at Eagle Point and went off the course a little to enjoy a small breakfast and waited for the sunrise and it was beautiful especially since the bridge was still lit up. After the sunrise, we hiked around and there are small beaches that you can go to and a labyrinth that you can see. The trail also leads all the way to Sutro Baths and the Cliff House. Sutro Baths has a visiting center and you can read about the history of the location. There is also a food place known as Luigi I believe and if you are hungry from the hike just stop on by! Another food place is Cliff house where you can enjoy the food along with a beautiful scenery of Ocean Beach. The view and hike is a great mini getaway from the city life.
author: Michelle H.

description:
This is my favorite urban hiking spot. On the edge of the city, yet so far away from the noise and hustle & bustle. You just can't beat a trail that starts at the Legion of Honor (a gorgeous structure amongst beautiful gardens), winds down along cliffs overlooking the mouth of San Francisco Bay, and ends at Sutro Baths. 

This recent Saturday in SF was unseasonably warm. It seemed that everyone on the trail was in a good mood, smiling & strolling & checking out the views. We took our time & really soaked in the surroundings. I don't know how many times we said "Can you believe it's February & we're having THIS kind of weather?!" 

The park service must have done some trail maintenance since the last time I was there cuz now there are paved paths & benches. It really looks nice.  Thank goodness there is still some money left in their budgets for these kinds of upgrades. 

We ended up at Sutro Baths & tried to imagine the grand bathhouse that used to stand in that spot. It must have been quite the place to be back in the day. 

You can keep on going & end up at the Cliff House for a fancy cocktail or continue down the hill to Ocean Beach. You really can make a whole day of it at Lands End.
author: Erin S.

description:
Beautiful little trail, such a nice break form the CITY part of SF! Really great views of the Golden Gate Bridge & Sutro Baths, the water, etc. 

Can be done in less than 1.5 hours at normal walking pace. Lots of young children & puppies on the trail. 

{Tip} Grab a hot chocolate at the cafe next to Guest Services (Pricey $4-$7) and take a nice walk up the trail. Gets a bit chilly in the early mornings since it's near the water. 

Almost can be considered a more eventful "walk" than a hike. Great for athletic nubs like myself :)
author: Christine Y.

description:
Bring a jacket because it tends to get chilly!

This dog-friendly trail offers gorgeous views of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. Check out the Sutro Baths while you're here, near Cliff House.

Note: the labrynth from the pictures no longer exists. In its place is a pretty sad, less intricate replacement maze. It's a bit tricky to find, but if you take steps down from the main trail toward the beach, then veer left to go down more stairs, you should find it. Use the rock formations in the background of the yelp pictures as a guide.
author: Michael W.

description:
BEST: Location
There is plenty of parking in the lot available or side parking along the street.

Conveniently there is a bathroom in the main structure. Down the road a bit is the Cliff House for Brunch.

The trail is roughly 3.4 miles from the beginning to Eagles Point.  If you continue on El Camino del Mar, you can reach China Beach.

There are other options to walk the trail with steeper incline. Some reaching to the Legion of Honor and views of the Golden Gate Bridge.

WORST: No picnic tables.

It can be chilly on most days because this trail is near the Bay.
author: K G.

description: I love coming here for a quick walk through then enjoying some time on the beach afterwards. There's a great view of the Golden Gate bridge along the trail and it's not so difficult that you end up huffing and puffing along (most people wear street clothes on the trail). This has got to be one of my favorite trails in the area.
author: Kelly Y.

description:
Walked this trail Jan 12 2011 and 2013.  Always a great time, quality hike, and fascinating sights.  Seeing the GG for the first time each trip always amazes me.

The trail is within walking distance to Ocean beach which is worth the visit.  Go for a quick swim if the water is warm enough.  Nice wide beach with lots of room.

Lots of parking at the beach and Lands End.  This is one area/attraction I will always visit.
author: Laine D.

description: What a beautiful hike!!!  Wear good walking shoes, you do a lot of stair and hill climbing.  An amazing way to spend a day!
author: April D.

description: Such a cool place with amazing views and a nice hike. I've been here a couple of times. It's perfect on a beautiful clear day, but you can still enjoy it on the common foggy day. I've experienced both.
author: Angela D.

description:
Our time here was awesome!!  We parked on the street (no charge) right in front of China Beach then proceeded to Coastal Trail and Mile Rock beach down to the labyrinth which is right on a cliff.  Me and my husband seriously finished the whole maze thinking something magical was gonna happen. Nope.  

Somewhere along the way we passed through Eagles Point.  There are so many great photo ops and it was pretty empty for being a Saturday around noon.  

We took the stairs up to see USs SF Memorial then went on to Sutro Baths where there is a little cave at the bottom that you can go into which was short and sweet... but cute.  On our way back we took the Del Mar Trail and stopped at Legion of Honor. They had a small area dedicated to the Holocaust which I'll post a pic of.  I appreciated it.

We went to Angel Island today, and let me tell you, we paid so much for a not so fantastic hike like we had at Lands End Trail.  This is definitely one of my favorite places to hike.  So if you're trying to make a decision on where to go, choose this bad boy =)
author: Sophia T.

description: Land's End is absolutely AMAZING! I live to hike on trails like these. Breath-taking views, mystery pathways, and labyrinths. SF got me falling in love all over again. This is an easy hike so it's perfect for first timers. Plenty of free parking here too. Simply amazing.
author: Anne P.

description:
Kinda bummed they tore a big chuck of forest out to build a new parking lot and stairs down the side of the hill so people barely need to walk to see the wonderful view. It was already accessible to all people with ramps, etc. Why allow busloads of impatient tourists 30 second access to this peaceful spot?
Def not an improvement here.

Now I'm worried there will be too many people and I'll no longer be able to do the bike ride that I've done faithfully for more than a decade (or take a peaceful walk.) 

What next? Hawkers and vendor kiosks here?
author: Brian J.

description:
Made it out on a bright and sunny December Sunday morning. It's a very easy trail to navigate with plenty of directional signs, but also a good amount of side trails to explore on future visits. We started at the Sutro bath ruins (make sure to enter what looks like a cave to the the north of the ruins - the waves lap against the rock protecting you and it creates a really powerful experience), walked up to the terrace vista, and meandered along the Coastal Trail, stopping at the USS memorial, Mile Rock Beach, and the Labyrinth. There's breathtaking views pretty much the whole way, whether of the ocean, the bridge, cliffs, or trees, and the trail is easy though fairly damp.

On our way back we headed up the ramp toward the VA building, walked around the Octagon lookout house and took in a pretty great view of the ocean and Western end of the city. It was really quiet in this part - could be a great place for a slightly secluded picnic (there were several tables) if you need a break from the pretty steady stream of people on the main trail.

All of us had a great time, including our small dog, 2 20-somethings, and my getting-older mama who had surgery last month but still had no problem maneuvering along the trail, hills, and stairs.

We followed our morning hike with a late lunch from Lucca's deli on Irving (between 19th and 20th) that we enjoyed in the park. It was a pretty perfect day.
author: Megan S.

description: Seriously stunning scintillating shower sparks and stars sobering serenely silken seascape songs singing slivered strands of sunrise-sunsets.
author: D W.

description: Awesome trail. Beautiful views of he Golden Gate Bridge on a clear day. Visitor center at the start of the trail is very informational. Easy trail. Lots of stairs. Wear good hiking shoes. You can take the trail all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge which is awesome. I'm not a huge fan of SF because of all the people and traffic. And this trail was actually pretty populated when we went on a Saturday. But def well worth the experience
author: Shelly W.

description: A gorgeous seaside park in SF.  However, I don't recommend visiting because a bunch of spider monkeys infected with Ebola have been biting tourists.  No photo op is worth your health, so you're probably better off going to fisherman's wharf.
author: Big Baby Jesus C.

description:
what a gem! I enjoyed this trail so much! went on a beautiful Saturday morning and although there were quite a few ppl on the trail, it was still manageable and not extremely overcrowded. I found parking immediately right at the entrance of Coastal Trail between China Beach and Mile Rock Beach. I got to see both beaches, the labyrinth, the Sutro Baths, and beautiful panoramic views of the Golden Gate Bridge.

The hike was easy, not much of a workout but with stairs descending to the beaches which were super clean and had beautiful rocks/caves! I would love to come back on a weekday with less ppl/kids for some privacy. It took me 3hrs down to Cliffhouse and back. Plenty of shade and photo ops. 

I did also run into a few older men sunbathing in their man thongs within the crevices of the rocks further down along the beach...that was awkward, hah.

But I'd definitely come back on a weekday with a packed lunch to enjoy some quiet time with the spectacular views.
author: Tina N.

description: This place is right near sutro's bath! Going down mile rock trail was honestly worth it to go down to see the rock labyrinth. Although there were lots of stairs to get towards the destination, it was worth the burn. Great for beginners!
author: Cuc N.

description:
I walk along the cliffs of Lands End and my mood shifts to a significantly higher level of cheer. 

As it goes, I have not passed by one unhappy person on my hikes along Lands End. Even the most unruly of children calm and take in the beautiful smells, the breathtaking view of Golden Gate, and the energy that lives here. This energy is similar in places such as Baker Beach, China Beach, and the Marin Headlands. I have spent a lot of time walking, thinking, and breathing deeper because of this trail.
author: Jocelyn B.

description: This park trail offers magnificent views of the Golden Gate. We did not walk the entire trail but just from the parking lot to the first viewing point where you can see the Pacific and the GG Bridge. Very nice.
author: Kenson K.

description: Awesome! Just make sure when you go with someone that you meet at the right part of the trail. There's even a paved trail for bikers. Am thinking of bringing my kiddos to bike along this beautiful trail.
author: Christine P.

description: This place is my favorite scenic spot in sf. Where the land meets the water ! Gorgeous enough to make you forget you're in the city! Love how the water looks over the cliffs when the sun is setting! Explored this spot with my boyfriend, but haven't seen all of it yet!
author: Tran N.

description:
The greatest trail hands down. The trail is around 3 miles and breathtaking. You walk/hike/run on a variety of trails as it switches from concrete to dirt and stairs. There are many scenic points and it has become my favorite place to run on the weekends. The view of the Golden Gate Bridge is amazing and can't be beat. On a sunny day you can see far out and it instantly relieves all the stresses on your mind. People bring their dogs and their children all their time.

Parking is available on either side of Lands End Trail. There's a parking lot near the Sutro Baths entrance.
author: Samantha L.

description: My fiancé proposed here back in February it was beautiful and breathtaking. Make sure to bring tennis shoes and a jacket its a small hike and it gets chilly
author: Stephany T.

description: Great place for a long hike, lots of places to explore and trails to go on. Only spent a little time here, but if you want to go on a costal hike, this is the place to go. Bring a jacket.
author: Matin F.

description: This is one of the best hiking/walking spots in the city. It's great place to bring visitors take pics and trail is not difficult at all. You can see a nice view of golden gate bridge  from many areas on the trail. There is a walking path down to a rocky beach where the waves crash spectacularly against the rocks and a climb to a cliff overlooking the ocean.
author: Dawit A.

description:
One trip is not enough to see all that there is to see on the Coastal Trail of Land's End. The Coastal Trail is a totally paved and marked trail, super easy to hike. There are unpaved trails that lead you deep into the greenery, to the water, or to a cliff (watch out now!). Going off trail is highly recommended, whether towards the water or further in towards the park and historic military sites. Again, I can't stress it enough, watch out for the cliffs, the random drops, the soft land near the random drops...ya know. They try to place signs at the danger areas, but of course, going off trail means you travel at your own risk.

During my last visit, GF and I had a lovely picnic near a cliff. We sat under a large tree with branches over our head, the sun beamed on us through the spaces of the branches, our feet dangled over the cliff, we had a view of the trees with the ocean right behind it, we could hear the waves from a far, we could hear birds all around us, the aroma of nature was apparent...
author: Helen L.

description: Lands End is one of the many reasons I love San Francisco -- it's such a privilege to enjoy both city and nature here in this little 7x7. The Sutro Bath Ruins are so cool, and there's a little cave you can explore. You get beautiful views of the Golden Gate Bridge, too! The labyrinth is mostly gone now, but it's still pretty cool to see.
author: Kelly R.

description:
If you want a good view of the ocean and the Golden Gate Bridge, go here anytime of the year except in the summer. For all you out of towners, the fog hugs the city like a blanket in the summer. Otherwise, it is quite beautiful. The trail has some amazing views of the ocean. I highly recommend you go an hour before sunset. That gives you plenty of time to walk slow and enjoy the view. The trail itself is not bad either. It has steps that take you all the way up a hill then descends quite quickly, so make sure to bring water if you're not physically fit. It's a short hike but a little on the moderate side if you can't stand hiking hills. 

Along the trail, you'll find plenty of benches. Perfect for an afternoon hike with your significant other. Totally romantic. Lastly, I recommend you start your hike from the north end which will take you all the way down to the parking lot and down to restaurants like Louis', the Cliff House, and Beach Chalet. I highly recommend you hike down on to the Great Highway along the beach. It's a beautiful hike, better than any trail you'll find in the east side of SF.

*Included pics
author: Liz V.

description: What a beautiful trail! This is by far the best hiking trail to go on. There ae multiple mini trails that lead right to the beach, the labyrinth, Sutro Bathhouses, Legion of Honor, and Ocean Beach. As soon as you begin the trail, you get an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge. There is always parking readily available around the residential areas. I absolutely love this trail. I would have to say it is my favorite hiking trail I have been on.
author: Surge C.

description: Yes, it is awesome. Great views, great sunset, unique, has a little cave, can find more private places to hang out, and other cool stuff. Plus it's got beaches on two sides so there's plenty to do nearby too.
author: Jason H.

description:
b.e.a.uuu.tiful trail and i highly recommend anyone visiting sf to incorporate viewings of the magnificent golden gate bridge with an easy peasy hike!  

i brought my dog barrington on the hike with me, though he turned a bit brown by the end of the hike from the dirt trail but nevertheless we had tons of fun.  

you start the hike off with a great view of the golden gate bridge and flat trails.  the trail does get progressively harder with stairs but it is not a difficult trail at all.  you will have different opportunities to see more views of the golden gate bridge at different points on the trail.  

make sure you bring doggie poop bags and go on a clear day for a clear view of the golden gate bridge!
author: Alice C.

description:
Beautiful trail with varied landscape and gradient. It ends at GGB and passes through Baker beach (yes,Baker beach... ;P ) Easy trail. Can be more challenging if you choose to  run rather than hike. 
Coastal/Lands end trail is approx 7 miles both ways.  Parking is not an issue,enough parking space nearby.
author: S S.

description:
Take this hike and you'll know why the San Francisco/Marin coastline is the envy of those the world over. Breathtakingly beautiful. Makes me want to scream and tell all the tourists I'm a native San Franciscan as I beam with pride. I never get tired of these views or take them for granted. 

Even the flabby, naked guy on Baker beach looked good against this backdrop.
author: Mark M.

description:
It's a beautiful trail. Makes me love living here! 

You'll see outrageously stunning views of the water, cliff, Golden Gate Bridge, Marin headlands. Great place to spend a beautiful afternoon.

Be sure to bring a jacket. The wind and fog Karl can get pretty crazy.
author: Dawn H.

description:
100th Review, I dedicate to you, Lands End!

- Beautiful hike with scenic trails that hug the coastline (pray for a clear day!)
- Fairly easy hike (the harder parts are if you choose to go down the multitude of steps that lead you to a lil' shore area that also will lead you to the mini-maze)
- Parking is easy by Sutro Baths & the hike to the Legion of Honor & back won't take you longer than 1.5hrs, and that's if you're stopping for pics, etc.

One of those many reasons I love this city & am so proud & deliriously happy & blessed to live in it =)
author: Anjali V.

description: Just a stunningly beautiful trail that's perfect for any occasion (so long as the weather's nice). Take your time and stop and explore, or make it a work-out and power-hike. Either way, you'll be satisfied. :)
author: Josephine L.

description:
Finally made it out there!!!!!

I've been dying to check it out.. And I cannot wait to go back. It's a really good workout if you make it so. Run all of the stairs up. Run on the beach. Run all of the uphill... climb rocks alongside the beach... great core and leg workout (without even knowing it!)... such amazing views... honestly, it can easily be such an easy little stroll, too, which is the beauty of it all! so many trails are either easy or hard, but I feel like this one's great because you can make it what you want it to be....

I'm going back on my day off! yay!
author: Christine C.

description: I love this trail. to walk or run, it is such a beautiful place and always great weather. plus there's the Golden Gate Bridge front and center!
author: Vivian H.

description: This place has some beautiful views of the bay. It's peaceful and not overly crowded with tourists. There are many different trails that can get you off of the beaten path. After having lived in the Bay Area for a few years now, why am I just now coming here?? Enjoy!
author: Robert H.

description: Visited Lands End on a clear day.  Plenty of parking.  It's a pretty easy trail and you get to see amazing views of the Golden Gate Bridge.  The trail leads to Sutro Baths, a Labyrinth, and a cave where waves can potentially get violent beyond the "warning" sign.  There were plenty of people on the trail.  If you plan on running, be prepared to be dodging people constantly.  Most people were just walking.  If you have people visiting from out of town Lands End would be a nice place to bring them for a scenic walk.
author: Christine D.

description:
My favorite home trail. (:

Great walk that everyone can do. If you go on a beautiful day, you'll have an awesome view of the Golden Gate Bridge, the ocean, Sausalito ... and whatever else you can see on that side.
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
This park is a very nice place to visit and for a small hike. To the east, there's a very nice view of Golden Gate Bridge here on a clear day. To the west, there's waves after waves of ocean. A nice calm view of the ocean. There's a parking lot in the center of this place, which makes it very easy and convenient to head here. 

The trail is not too bad. It's a mostly a solid dirt path that goes up and down some slopes. It's not too bad, but it can be pretty tiring. Nice place to head for a walk or a jog. Be sure to bring some water. You'll need it!

On the west side of Lands End, there's the ruins of Sutro Baths and the new visitor center that thy made. The center has books and various nice history about Sutro baths and Lands End in general. On the right side is the nice maze that everyone has a picture of. Oh, there's also a very small beach somewhat hidden in this place. Nothing special about the beach, but it's pretty nice place to head to if you want to be alone. Not a lot of people at this beach.
author: Steven B.

description:
This is a more of a casual walk (1.5 miles end to end) than a true hike but nevertheless it was beautiful.  You get outstanding views of the ocean/bay and Golden Gate Bridge as you walk on a trail with very little elevation change. You can go down to the Labyrinth, or what used to be, and get a landscape view of the waters leading to GGB.  Unbelievable place to take a companion and take pictures.  There are many benches along the way that provide minutes of relief and conversations with someone else.  

I came here on a semi-sunny Saturday which was perfect weather for walking with a few layers but not for taking pictures.  The top half of GGB was covered with fog and I decided to leave my camera in my backpack.  However, the views were still gorgeous and areas that got sunshine were pretty.  The good thing about this place is that it's in the city so I can go anytime due to the short drive.  

You'll bump into a number of people and dogs but that shouldn't deter you from checking this place out.  I parked at the 48th Avenue parking lot and got lucky with a spot.  The lot is sizable but don't bank on an open space when it gets crowded.
author: Orangen B.

description:
Needing inspiration, a break from the monotony, I hiked it over to Land's End Trail. Got my Nature on! It was perfect for someone like myself that is not the outdoorsy type (aspiring), and once in while would like to get off my bike and walk, but with an hint of challenge. I walked it, might run it next time. It was somewhat crowded, yet still manageable, not annoying. Next time, I'll try some of the trails that branch off, tried to stay focused. 

P.S. Doing the trail in barefoot shoes isn't an issue.
author: Brian S.

description:
This place is gorgeous.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet --the modifications at the trail head are very modern without taking away from the beauty of the space (end of Ocean beach near the Cliff House and the Sutro Baths --where you'll find *free* parking).

Be sure to wear shoes for the outdoors as after a certain point on the modified trail, the path turns to an uneven dirt/gravel path.  This is also a good place to ride your bicycle, but beware of walkers on some parts of the path that tend to narrow considerably.  The trail winds along the coast as you are able to see in the maps at the trail head, and ends up south of Baker Beach in the Presidio a little north of Legion of Honor.

There is generally fresh air and tons of sunshine, but as it is the coast, it can often get windy and chilly, so windbreakers are recommended.

Views, fresh air, and a solid path.  I'm in love and do make it a point to visit often.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Totally loved this place! Went on a hike with my boyfriend in the middle of the week so it wasn't too crowded. Nice trails, GREAT photo background opportunities and the souvenir shop was cute too! It started to get pretty windy so be sure to layer up! Definitely enjoyed my time here!
author: Kassie P.

description: Cannot believe I didn't visit this place earlier. The most scenic trail i've seen in San Francisco. Once you get to the end of it, there is a beautiful beach and Tahoe-Like rocks on the shore which you can climb. 5 Stars.
author: Vydesh R.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the hike at Lands End today.  It was not a strenuous hike at all & the views were absolutely spectacular!  I seriously recommend this hike to anyone who do not have a pace maker inside you.  And those who do, pace yourselves & you will be fine. 

The weather was a bit overcast with somewhat strong winds so it was a bit chilly on parts of the trail.  However, I came prepared so I was fully suited up for the Wind God's little farts. 

What I should have brought along but didn't was snacks. Dang it.  But the VA (which is very near the trail) saved the day because I hiked up to the canteen and satisfied my hunger.  Thanks, Obama & Uncle Sam!
author: Michael L.

description: If you are in SF for a few days, this makes a nice break from all the sight-seeing.  The price is right (free), and the views are worth $$$$.  You can hike along the shore line - especially nice as the sun sets - or hang out at the beach area.
author: Susan K.

description: Pretty good views, and easily accessed if you're in the city... ample amounts of free parking. Peaceful, but still doesn't compare to the hikes and trails outside of the city (but I guess that's obvious).
author: Diana K.

description: There are plenty of people on these trails, but it's very easy to take at your own pace. Race a pal up the stairs for an added workout, and treat your eyes and brain to one of the best damned views found at the edge of a continent. I used to live near here, and it was one of the best parts of these, uh, parts. A revisit within the last few months reminded me of how this corner of the world will never get old. Great for outdoorsy visitors (Golden Gate Bridge views always go down smooth) or active locals alike. Bonus easy access to Sutro Baths!
author: Tara R.

description: This is a total must-see for my visitors (weather permitting). We take the N to the beach.. or you can drive, plenty of parking. Then you just follow the coast up to the the Cliff House, Sutro Bath, Lands End lookout, under the cypress trees and up some pretty steep steps. You can stop by the Legion of Honor, Baker Beach and the labyrinth (and some amazing views of the GG Bridge). Or.. you know, keep walking until you reach the bridge. It's not a strenuous hike at all, so really family friendly.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Another truly great place for pictures and just to feel nature just at the edge of the city.

Bay area, coastal, and city scape/bridge views. Bring a camera

A great trail, allot of parking available.

It can get windy along the water though. 

You can make you way towards Golden Gate by going through Seacliff and Baker Beach.
author: Roger A.

description:
A fantastic trail if you know about it.  A bit of Monterey in San Francisco.  From reading these reviews, apparently more people know about it now.

Easy access.  Great views of the ocean and Golden Gate.  Quite popular, so you probably won't have the entire trail to yourself.  If you're entertaining active people from out of town, and they're getting claustrophobic from wall-to-wall housing, this is a good option for them.

I saw the trail listed in a "Rails-To-Trails" book, so it was probably an old railway route in the distant past.  Which means that it's basically a flat trail.  If you want hills, they're here too, but that means meandering off trail.

Dress warm, of course;  this is the coast.  Although it's heavily treed, and they serve as a sometimes-effective windbreak.
author: Ron L.

description: This trail is nice and has got a pretty view, however it's super crowded with dogs running around. Parking is painful and if you're looking for a relax hiking experience there are better areas in the bay. It felt like a crowded park rather than a hiking trail. I'm not going back!
author: farnoosh f.

description:
I love this trail!  It is a lovely walk and you get gorgeous views of the GG bridge and the water. It is a nice mix of shade and sun and very green. I don't like trails without shade cover where I feel like I am walking underneath the burning sun. This is the opposite!

It's also extremely accessible from the city. The start of the trail from the opposite end of the Sutro baths is a bit nondescript, but you can find it pretty easily. You can park around the golf course or a little further away if you don't want your car near a golf course.

You can run it as a trail run too - pretty fun. May get crowded on a nice weekend. There can be a lot of stairs in some parts, especially if you go down to the water, so you can get a workout that way too.
author: Veronica H.

description:
This is my first review ever, I had to write it after a hike up this trail.

Just yesterday, I got up, realized how gorgeous the weather was and wanted to find a good trail, maybe a secret spot in the Berkeley/SF area. I yelped "secret spots" in SF, and found Lands End Trail. The pictures don't do justice, this is absolutely one of the most gorgeous, surreal landscapes I've ever seen. As you hike up, there's stunning views of the Golden Gate, and I'm from the SF bay area so I can spot a good view of the Golden Gate when I see it. I got up there around sunset, and if you ask hikers passerby the way to the labyrinth, the view from where you peer down to see the labyrinth is simply stunning. The waves wash up the shore and creates this magnificent pattern of foam, that washes up against  this seashore, as if untouched by man, old wooden logs atop of giant pebbles. Bring your cameras!!
author: Grace C.

description: finally made it to lands end today with the hubs (first year anniversary hike!!) and puppy dog. as others have noted, it's a gorgeous and fairly mellow hike. beyond the beautiful scenic views and historical appeal, the highlight of the day was seeing a bunch of dolphins playing in the ocean. pretty special. we'll definitely make this a regular weekend destination, especially since we missed the labyrinth this time around, much to my hubby's dismay.
author: Connie S.

description: this area of the city is such a dream. can have your dog run free along the cliffs and paths, run into friendly people, and don't feel like you're in the city anymore. truly stunning views and a decent hike if you're looking to chat with friends.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Wow what a place!  I never knew this place existed and wish I knew earlier!  Hiking here is a great way to enjoy a nice sunny day in San Francisco - doing something healthy while also on the cheap and relatively hassle-free.  Great views (even better when the fog burns off), easy to find free parking, and just a feel-good happy spot.

Came here on a Sunday and had a good time hiking.  The hike itself wasn't very difficult, with clearly-marked trail info.  You can easily hike down to the water, or simply enjoy the view from the higher trail.  This is a great way to catch-up or get to know someone better.  Parking is ample.  I parked at El Camino del Mar, north of Point Lobos and 48th Street, instead of the 32nd and El Camino del Mar like the description here says.  Parking spots were ample and free.  

I would recommend coming here before noon, spend ~1.5-2 hours hiking around, checking out the scenery, and also seeing the Sutro Bath under Cliff House, then having brunch either at Cliff House, Louis' or Seal Rock Inn.
author: Leo C.

description:
such an awesome place! You can reach the sutro baths/ cliff house, and the legion of honor from here! You can even see the USS SF memorial, golden gate bridge, andddddddd the coolest one, in my opinion, the labyrinth. It's a good hike/ walk. Lots of stairs but has a beautiful view. I like it! Free too. Even. Better. 

Park/ start from El Camino del Mar & 32nd Ave and make your way down. It takes about 30-45 min to reach the Labryinth from here.
author: Natalia H.

description:
I went to Land's End with two of my best friends and we had an amazing time. The baths and caves near the parking lot were really cool and the hike wasn't difficult but had amazing views. It was honestly one of the prettiest hikes I've been on, with beautiful views of the Golden Gate Bridge and the bay all throughout.

I was pretty disappointed by the "labyrinth", though. I was expecting an intricate rock maze from the pictures I had seen on google. However, I was sad to see that it no longer really exists. It looked as if someone had just moved some rocks into a weak formation for fun. 

Still, I had an amazing time and I recommend it to everyone, locals and tourists alike.
author: Rhea W.

description:
1 mile long trail. Lots of shade cover which is nice when it's sunny, which unfortunately when we went it wasn't... Some parts have unofficial trails that lead you closer to the cliff edge, but looks like part of the restoration included blocking off those paths. The side closer to Sutro is more touristy, paved with informative/historic signs. Great views of Marin and Golden Gate. Pretty easy walk, but some of the steps left me a little out of breath. 

Dog friendly, and bike friendly for the most part. Watch out for frat guys drinking 40s at mile rock point. Lots of places to park at either end of the trail, and at legion of honor. Trail wasn't too populated (saw good number of toursists), but might be busier when the weather is better. Dress in layers - gets cold when you're out in the wind, but i could wear shorts and t-shirt when the trees blocked the wind.

Recommend: starting at el camino del mar and 32nd, take the coastal trail to sutro for sunset, then walking the upper trail, past legion of honor, back to parking. Ample street parking at 32nd, and parking spaces in the lot at sutro.
author: Joyce C.

description: Easy walking trail with a pretty view.
author: Kristy F.

description:
This trail is awesome! On a sunny day, the view of the Golden Gate Bridge, the ocean and rock formations make the experience that much more awesome! There are places to take some great nature oriented and touristy photos, while also observing the beauty of nature in our very own city of San Francisco. 

During the weekdays in the morning, it is sort of empty which is nice, but after 2pm it is populated by trail runners, tourists and the like. I am glad I haven't seen much trash around since park police give you hefty tickets for littering. Thank you park police! 

Remember to wear a good pair of shoes with treads when you come here, the trail is not all paved like some other trails I know.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
One word. Breathtaking.
Thrillingly beautiful, remarkable, astonishing, exciting, 

I'm not sure if I've seen anything more beautiful! From the minute you start to the minute you end, I guarantee, it will captivate you in every way. For those outdoor loving people, do not miss the chance to experience this hike when you're in San Francisco! We were in town for a few days and our friends were showing us around knowing that we love things like this. Although being completely hungover, I'm so glad we did this hike. So, for those that are worried if the hike is difficult or not, if we could do it hungover, I'm sure you could do it sober ;)
author: Chris D.

description: Such a nice, relaxing trail with a beautiful view of the ocean and the Bay Bridge. It's a fairly easy hike - the land is mostly flat except for the staircase that leads you down to the beach. The stairs are narrow though, and I can imagine it being difficult to walk up/down when there's alot of people. The view is especially amazing when the sun is setting, and it definitely makes me appreciate the beauty of SF.
author: Nicole P.

description:
If you drive, park on Merrie Way or at the Legion of Honor depending on which way you're coming into the trail.
 Yes I drive to go walk.

Lands End Trail is 1 of those things that just makes up San Francisco. 
Easy hiking, more of a challenge if you choose to continue as far as you can toward the bridge.
Also awesome starting point for mt biking to Sausalito. 

GGNRA love
author: Athena S.

description: Views are great.  Easy walk except for the steps in the middle :-)  People take it at all speeds and everyone appears to be a good mood.  On low tides you can sometimes see part of the ship wreck at one point. Amazing to have such a spot along the ocean in the city.  Take advantage of it if you have not done.  I walk with my wife and wit the kids.  Funny that it was easier for the kids when they were younger.  Harder for teenagers :-)
author: Clifford S.

description:
Without question, my favorite place in the city. 

The main trail is a great hike on a Sunday morning with spectacular views of the bridge, the bay, and beaches all along. It's about a 1.5 mile hike going from the Seacliff neighborhood to Sutro Baths and the Cliff House. 

The real treasure of this area is being able to explore off the trail. The single best view in the city is Deadman's Point, which is up a very small hill just on the Seacliff side of the large staircase portion of the trail (the entrance to Deadman's Point is marked by a "stay on trail" sign - ignore it you won't be disappointed). 

There are hundreds of small trails that lead up and down the cliffs all throughout the park. An hour or two of wandering can lead you to secluded beaches, an abandoned, sidewise shell of a house, and amazing clearings in the forest. I've been dozens of times and am still finding new trails and interesting spots. Go and explore!
author: Louis D.

description: I didn't know such a place exist so close to SF.  We just visited here last Thankagiving.  The weather was perfect and only needed a light jacket.  Parking filled up fast so we parked along the street.  Someone spotted an otter in the ruins which is blooming with algae.  There are several different paths but you can tell from looking up or down.  There is a visitor center which gives you recommendations to walk around.
author: Phillip Y.

description: Love this little trail! Breathe-taking views of the San Francisco Bay & Golden Gate Bridge, dog-friendly, and if you're lucky, you can catch whales swimming by! Make sure you also check out the Sutro Bath Ruins :)
author: Tracy C.

description: This is one of my favorite places to take a walk in San Francisco. When it's sunny and clear out, the views of the bridge and the bay are breathtaking. When it's foggy and the crowds are gone, it's a great place for a quiet contemplative walk.
author: Michael S.

description:
I recently did a ride to Land's End, a perfectly fitting name for a perfect ride. Land's End is part of the Golden Gate National Recreation area, filled with hiking trails, windswept vistas, the Sutro Baths, the Cliffhouse, and more spectacular views of The Golden Gate Bridge. Two recommendations; 1) there is so much to see and experience, so make sure to allot yourself plenty of time. 2) Remember this is San Francisco and you are on the ocean. Make sure to carry a light windbreaker, scarf and hat. The wind will get fierce, and you will get cold.

I rode my bike from 19th/California towards 48th Avenue, ending at Seal Rock and El Camino del Mar Drives. You can take the bus--(#38L) or, if you choose to drive, there is tons of parking available.

I checked out the Sutro Baths first, or ruins, I should say. In 1896, the Sutro Baths were opened to the public as the world's largest indoor swimming pool. Visitors had a choice of seven different swimming pools that were ostentatious in appearance and style; with private dressing rooms, toboggan slides and the ability to accommodate 25,000 people!  The baths were so expensive to operate that they were closed in 1965, and then the building itself was burnt to the ground in 1966.

Overlooking the baths is The Cliffhouse Restaurant, which in and of itself is a San Francisco landmark. It began in 1858 and has had an amazing history. Today it is an exquisite Zagat rated and Michelin recommended establishment, with a great Sunday Brunch, walking tours and consistently touted as "San Francisco's Best Restaurant with a View", by travel journals and reviewers.

The Coastal Trail is clearly marked; bikes/no bikes. It is a beautiful, woodsy trail; light to moderate in difficulty. Since you can't take your bike all the way to the bridge from here, you can opt to ride through the 'bike only' sections of the trail, or lock it up in the parking lot and walk. If you choose to do the latter, the trail is about 3 miles long and fairly easy to meander. There are two staircases on the trail itself, but lots of trees, shaded areas and scenic views to enjoy along the way. I chose to chain my bike and stroll/hike along the trail. There are oodles of photo ops, paths leading down to the ocean, paths leading up into the trees. Whatever is your pleasure, it is here.

Unlike Golden Gate Park, this place is not overrun by tourists--(yet). Perhaps that's because it feels far removed or that you are going to the boondocks. Either way, it is an added pleasure for those who do venture this far out.

For pictures, history and more fun facts, visit my site at: http://thenoisebeneaththeapple.com/
author: Heather J.

description:
Where the heck am I? Surely can't be in the city. 
Where in the hell am I going? Just start here (Sutro Park) and, um take the Coastal Trail. 
Why in tarnation am I RUNNING my clumsy, weak-ankled ass up and down this trail? Because you need the exercise! And, because all that effort makes the view even MORE beautiful! 

Actually, the old man brought me here - so, I was thinking he was getting all romantic on me all of a sudden... guess the fog messed with my head a little (it sure messed with my hair). Instead, we got in a great workout in a beautiful setting. Sure, you can make this trail anything you want: a nice walk with the dog, a romantical stroll with the SO, or an excellent breathtaking (in more ways than one) workout. 

Although the rock labyrinth kinda creeped me out (reminded me of a scene in Pet Sematary), I kinda wish that I would have walked it, after seeing the trance-like state it put someone else in... not. 

Wish I could quit 24hr and join mother nature's gym!
author: Kara B.

description: Beautiful place to just walk around. Downside: too many stairs... my legs hurt the next day! Bring a jacket, it can get breezy and COLD! Burrr
author: Erica T.

description: beautiful views, great beaches, epitome of San Francisco exploration!  I love the easy trail that doesn't get you winded but is exciting to get to the top.  A great Sunday morning adventure with gorgeous views of the bridge, ocean, and beach
author: Christina K.

description:
Favorite outdoorsy spot in city (but not really IN the city? Haha) 

The trail offers gorgeous views of the Golden Gate Bridge and beyond that. One trail leads to others and you'll find little gems like the labyrinth or Sutro Baths. 

The trail itself isn't too tough. It's more like a scenery type trail which I love. At one point, you'll reach some stairs and that is a killer. Maybe because I don't work out and by the time I reach the 10th step I'm already out of breathe hahah but anyway..

Definitely take advantage of this beautiful trail! 

A plus: Trail is dog friendly!
author: Jessica C.

description:
An escape from reality into nature. If you are sick of being surrounded by cars and busy streets this is a nice little escape for a hike, walk, run or a picnic. For me it is an escape from work other than yelping at work XD. I work at the SFVAMC and a group of co-workers and I make this a daily lunch time walk. The escape that we need from the office to clear our minds, get some exercise and chitchat. I have been walking this trail for almost 2 years now. When i get out there and see the lovely view  it takes all the stress away. Even on a foggy day it is still nice to be out here. 

I remember the first time that Marie came to visit me at work and this was before we started going out. I told her there was a beautiful trail nearby my work and that we should go for a walk. It started off as a pleasant walk as the weather was gorgeous. We talked, walked and enjoyed the sun. Anyone that has walked this trail knows that there is a hill that leads to the golf course and then eventually the legion of honor. That hill holds special memories for Marie and me. We were walking up the hill and Marie was crackin a joke about me and it was starting to get on my nerves :P so I grabbed her close and kissed her till she was out of breath ;)  THE HEART MARKS THE SPOT!! 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yniMfk_yS1sk9dxPLDVchg?select=dIwGXLHU8QwFEaDPYymojQ

This is an awesome escape from the city if you don't plan to leave the city anytime soon. I recommend you come here to hike or enjoy the scenery. I feel lucky that I get to come to this when ever I have work.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Things that cool off a bad mood situation:

1.  Reading Günter Grass, The Tin Drum, on the beach.
2.  Machete.  I'd hire him.
3.  Three lattes in one day and text dating advice to a friend of mine.
4.  Take a nice stroll down Land's End Trail.

What another little gem along this beautiful coast and so blessed that we live in a city that plays host to so many cool trails.  This one wraps around the bluffs facing out towards the gateway and winds in and out of native landscaping with fantastic views of the Golden Gate Bridge.  

What I enjoyed about this trail, were the numerous other trails that branched off the main strip.  On my walk back I took the trail up towards the VA hospital.  This one meanders up a well maintained view, with lots of floral and bay views.  Jogging back down drove up my heart rate.

You can access the trail on either end of the trailhead, although I prefer parking at the lot near the Cliff House.  It is free and monitored frequently by SFPD.
author: Miika M.

description: Breathtaking. A gorgeous place on a gorgeous cloudy day with my gorgeous partner in crime. Easy and fun hike, the ocean smell and the waves set it up. A little gem that justified the $20 Uber ride here. I loved this.
author: Aaron S.

description: This trail was one of my favorite parts about visiting this beautiful city. It started off at a light amble, but got a little challenging as time went on. But not challenging in a bad way, but in the way a good hike should be. After a bit of a steep climb, one is always rewarded with a lovely view, or a hidden (well it seems hidden, but I'm sure its already been explored many times) little nook where the stillness seems lovely. Be sure to make it all the way to the top , and that way you can avoid most of those poor folk chained to their cell phones, or their squawky kids/ significant others. Eventually one is left with those few that are here to enjoy the view and revel in the stillness.
author: Umar G.

description: Nice trail to just walk. Park in their renovated parking lot. Good view to see ships coming to SF Bay. Views of Golden Gate. Trail to beach or USS San Francisco memorial or to Legion of Honor or Beach Maze. Dogs must be on leash. Watch out for joggers and mountain bikers to not get run over.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Great hiking spot!

Pros:
-Lots of different trails
-beautiful location
-dogs allowed

Cons:
-parking fills up fast

Naka, the bf, and I are regulars here and we always get a great workout (stairs, incline, long distance).  In addition, (when sunny) this is a beautiful location by the ocean (we spotted dolphins last time) and scenic.
author: J P.

description: This is an awesome hike, but you kind of need a car to get there. Great views of the bridge and Ocean. It is an awesome setting. Bring your camera!
author: Danny B.

description: Adventuretime has never been so fun until now.  Land's end offers amazing views of the shoreline and the GG bridge with a peaceful, easy stroll along the coast.  There's a bunch of side paths you can take if you're feeling ambitious.  I suggest checking out the labyrinth and the beach.  The rocks there are very colorful and would be great to take home to put on your mantle.  Just sayin'
author: Alex G.

description:
Top reasons why I adore this trail: the view of the beautiful Golden Gate Bridge, stunning lookout points of the crashing waves of the ocean, the crisp smell of wildlife plants, and the ending at Legion of Honor.

This trail is for beginner hikers, brisk walk takers, and maybe active runners. The reason why I say, "maybe," is because there are a lot of people who walk this narrow trail and depending on what kind of runner you are, you may (or may not) become annoyed of all the traffic as you are trying to wiz on by.

It is an easy 3 mile-ish walk from the parking lot and back with no really dramatic inclines (except for the set of stairs in the middle... which I did stop to take a break because I am a lazy son of a gun). For the most part, it's pretty flat and I find it impossible to get lost.

I highly suggest stopping at every lookout point if it is your first time because you will be blown away by the spectacular views. All-in-all, if you detour to all the lookout points, it'll add another half a mile-ish to your walk. No big deal, even for a lazy bum like me.

If you're looking for a challenge, go elsewhere. But for those who are seeking a lovely Sunday afternoon walk alongside the Golden Bridge and clear waters, make yourself at home here. =)
author: Frances T.

description:
The view is breathtaking no matter where you stand!
I always get lost in the beauty of this place everytime I'm here and probably have like 300 pictures of every angle!

I love coming here on a sunny day, taking a leisure hike with friends. It's so relaxing. It also feels amazing to come here before sunrise and listen to the magnificent sound of crashing waves, while watching the sun play colors in the sky.

It's a great place to take a step back from the hustle-bustle of the city and enjoy mother nature a bit.
author: Jenny M.

description:
My new favorite place in the city!

Sometimes you just need to get out of the city, however it can be such a hassle because you either have to take bart or whatever and deal with traffic just to get away from the tourists and city buildings.

Lands End is convenient and absolutely beautiful. My girlfriend and I rented a zip car for two hours and drove over there. We explored the trails, sit and enjoy the beach, and climb a hill to look over the cliffs of the San Francisco Bay.

Whether you are looking for a quick scenic hike or some time for yourself to relax and enjoy the green and blue surroundings.
author: Nic P.

description: Yeah Muir woods is cool, the Cataract trails is pretty great, but this place is practically in my backyard. And way less populated.  You've got trees, the water, the bridge, and a series of cool landmarks.  The main trail is relatively flat and easy, and I'm pretty sure it offers the freshest air in the city..
author: Eva L.

description: What a beautiful trail!  We only had less than an hour to spend on the trail so we chose to take our time and just do part of the trail.  We found a spot where we could see both side of the bay, sat for a while & just took in the beauty of this place.  It was cold from the breeze but we toughed it out so we could take in the view..this is a absolute must if you come to SF!
author: Judy S.

description:
I went exploring here with my friend on a gorgeous Friday afternoon- we definitely got lucky with the weather. The GPS got us kind of lost, but we eventually found it. 

We decided to be adventurous and make our own trails and we had hella fun. The views we saw were amazing and we found great spots for jumping pictures and 10 second timer pictures since there were only 2 of us. 

The hike isn't too rigorous either so nothing to worry about. 

If you have friends from out of town who enjoy the outdoors, I highly recommend taking them here and going exploring.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Wheather you are visiting San Francisco or live in the area, this trail is a must. We went on a sunny day with our dog jogged  from the west all the way to the east near the golf course. Saw lots of other dogs, families, tourist, runners enjoying the sun. It's not a long hike, nor is it a difficult one. Although there's lots of steps to climb, but it's not bad, beginners can walk this trail.
As you head further east you'll see a couple of areas to stop and take photos of the Golden Gate Bridge. And to the west is the old bath house area and Cliif House restaurant. You can watch the waves hit the rocks or sit near the end of a cliff and smell the ocean. 
Lots of parking near the beach or El Camino Del Mar.
author: Chris H.

description:
Nice hike today!!!  Seems like this was the spot to go to because it was crowded. I walked around the shops then decided to hike this area. 

Hiked my way down the path and checked out the mini cave, walked around the swamp area and watched the birds / waves. It was nice checking out the students taking pictures. It must have been bring a model day or something because three different areas they were doing the same thing for a photography / art class.  

Some areas were difficult hiking back up but I managed.  I took a lot of pictures and was just admiring the nature & the birds.
author: Ivy N.

description:
One of the best trails the city has to offer. The views are spectacular and it's a relatively easy hike(there are some stairs to access the beach and certain parts of the trail). You can begin with Sutro Baths ruins, walk through the forest, head to the beach, see the Golden Gate Bridge and discover the Labyrinth. Perfect for dogs too! 

Definitely recommend it for Sunday morning, followed by brunch at Louis' nearby.
author: Laura H.

description:
Absolutely lovely. Almost 5 stars, except that it was pretty crowded when J and I went on a sunny and clear weekend. 

I enjoyed the placards placed along the trail describing historically significant and interesting sights. Trail itself is easy to walk or jog/run, has plenty of shaded areas, and gets a good amount of ocean breeze to keep you cool. There are a few steep portions if you plan on walking down to the beach (ie: Mile Rock Beach), but overall fairly consistent grade.

One day I'll walk the bridge and back :]
author: Susanna W.

description:
What an absolutely gorgeous park!! Here are all the pros:
-Easy to park since it has its own parking lot

-EASY to walk.  I went with my mom and would recommend it for people of all ages and families. As long as you like to walk you'll be fine since most of the park has little/no climbing required.  There are some stairs you can take to go to different areas but if you wanted to do an easy walk you can just stay in the main path.  

-You can spend a long time here. I've been to Lands End twice and haven't explored everything it has to offer yet.

-GORGEOUS views - a great escape.

-Conveniently located next to the Cliff House. Nothing beats a hike followed by coffee and truffle fries at Sutro.
author: Mrs. G.

description:
Land's End allows me to feel like I've left the city for a little while and to get rid of my concrete claustrophobia.  

I try to get out of the city to go for a hike every chance I get and usually head to Pt. Reyes or the headlands, but when a car just isn't available, Land's End is perfect.   

The hike is actually more of a walk along the cliffs and has spectacular views. 

Check out the labyrinth:
http://flickr.com/photos/laulau18/3098371357/in/set-72157610713991125/
author: Lauren C.

description:
My goodness this trail is GORGEOUS.  On a clear day, I don't know if life could get any better than this.

I wouldn't really call this a hike but its a nice walk thru this beautiful park.  You loop thru, hit some mind blowing lookout points, find hidden steps that leads you to a beach with what could be the most romantic scenery.  

Absolutely love the fact that this park is so close to the city.  SF has so much to offer!!  Another good spot to take my friends who will visit and they will wish they could live in the beautiful Golden State.
author: Nho C.

description:
One of the most beautiful places in San Francisco that is not crawling with tourists. Part of the Golden Gate National Park Conservancy, you will get a wonderful view of our landmark bridge - providing that it is a clear day.

We started at the neigborhood of Outer Richmond to the Cliff House/Sutro Bath and back. If you start the other way, parking might be in issue in the weekend because Cliff House is choke full of tourists. The walk is about 3 miles long roundtrip. We took the paved Coastal Trail and brought our dog with us since it is a dog-friendly place. The first part of the walk is harder with a little climb up and down. However, after that initial part, the rest is easy as pie. Along the way, there are two look-out points to Golden Gate Bridge where you can sit down and enjoy the fresh air. As you walk the trail, you will hear foghorns continously. It's rather soothing and somehow weirdly reminds me of the book, Treasure Island (ships and pirates). There was a part of the trail that has eucalyptus trees and it just smelled so wonderful.

If you are bringing a dog, dogs are recommended to be leashed because some dogs have fallen off the cliff. I saw unleashed dogs walking there, though. They were the best behaved dogs - just walking with their owners, minding their own business. I leashed my dog because he is not the most obedient dog. However, it was funny that he would root himself to the earth whenever he was 2-ft away from a cliff, refusing to go any nearer. I was not trying to get him to the edge, but just trying to move and give way to people walking faster than us. Smart little dog, though!

I would recommend this place if you are looking for a relaxing walk. Also, dont miss out on Sutro Bath while you are there.
author: July N.

description:
I really enjoy the Lands End Trail in SF.  It's one of my favorite spots for running, strolling, and people watching.  

Here's how I like to explore the trail:
I start off from trail head, the one with the Lands End sign.  I head to the platform for the first of many breath-taking views.  I "do not" break the rules and sneak beyond the trail for more gorgeous views of the Golden Gate Bridge--you know, that one view that nobody else really sees.  I head off one trail by taking the stairs straight down to the cliff where I can see the labyrinth right below.  Then I continue down the original trail, towards Ocean Beach.  I end up by the bathhouse, venture through the cave that leads to nowhere.  Then I come out just in time for sunset over the rocks.  If I look carefully I might see a heart-shaped hole in one of the rocks.  Pretty cool, if you ask me.
author: Linda T.

description: Incredibly gorgeous views, some exercise, free, and somehow right in the city! Could it get any better? A great place during the day and during sunset. Could be a little dangerous if really windy, but should be okay. Honestly, the trail isn't that hard for someone who doesn't mind some daily walking, unless you take too many stairs at a time--and there are a lot of stairs!
