description: Great trail.  Some stairs.  Views!  2.8 miles round trip so not exactly a huge workout.
author: Richard C.

description:
Lol, not sure why I really need to add to the high volume of excellent reviews here, but why not add my own two cents :). 

I've been hiking on the trail twice now! The first time I went with my boyfriend who had fun taking photographs of the beautiful scenery. The second time I took my family which I thought was a great choice for a not-too-touristy thing to do with my parents! The hike was great for them because it is quite easy, minus some stairs. 

When you go here on a day when the whether is perfect, it seriously makes the hike! The hike follows a beautiful, rocky shoreline and clear views of the Golden Gate Bridge with all of the sailboats sailing under it is definitely something to stop and take in. 

The trail is also super easy to get to. Taking Bus 38 (costs only $1.50 for a day ticket) somewhere along Geary heading west will take you all the way down to Geary and 38th street where you can hop out and walk a couple of blocks to the Sutro Baths and start the hike. Or, there is an abundance of parking spaces near the entrance of the trail. Just drive down Geary until it hits Point Lobos. 

I gave the trail 4 stars because it is always pretty crowded, but not so much so that it takes away too much from the experience. I guess this isn't that great kept of a secret after all :).

And, if I lived closer to San Francisco, I would definitely take my dog here. Almost everyone had their doggies on leashes and they looked happy to be on the trail as well.
author: Eileen E.

description: To get away from the hustle and bustle of the city without actually leaving the city, I like to take the coastal trail at Land's End, especially Mile Rock Beach Trail towards the cliff above the labyrinth.  I was starting to think this Labyrinth didn't exist.  I always looked out towards the ocean and Mile Rock Beach and never thought to look straight down. Lo and behold, there goes the Labyrinth!  The views along this trail are amazing and you get a clear shot of the Golden Gate Bridge.  A great walk or hike for anyone.
author: Cindy G.

description: This was the first part of our adventurous Saturday. We parked by the legion of honor and started the hike. We were too sure where we were going but saw wonderful views of the bridge. Eventually we ended up on one end which was the sutro baths. So we figured to try the other side because we really wanted to see the labyrinth. From one side to another barely takes 20 minutes. It was a super easy hike, yes there was stairs, but all the better for your butt! Getting to the top to get an aerial view of the labyrinth was probably the trickiest part, the same goes for getting down. So if you are with children or the elderly please be careful. to the right side of the labyrinth is the perfect spot for a photo in front of the bridge, take advantage of this perfect photo opportunity! We decided to take a shortcut back but ended up on the golf course, so I advise you to stay on the trail! Overall it was a easy hike, very scenic and perfect way to start or end your date!
author: Amy G.

description:
Ooo! Ooo! I love this area. Beautiful views and fresh air aside, parking at Ocean Beach and running up the hill past the Cliff House, past the Sutro Baths all the way into Land's End where the steps are and back is a great little run.

You can also get lost in a good way, if you want - always a pleasure. 

I think they also make shirts.
author: Adam L.

description:
Very pretty - you don't feel like you are in the city at all.  

And you can hike down to one of the little cove beaches.  

A hidden gem!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Went for a run here the other day after parking in Sutro Heights.  Ran to Sea Cliff and back.. Some of the cliffs are markedly steep, dangerous, and people have fallen.

Frankly... I could fall there and die happy.  One of the most stunning places in the city, and possibly... well.. anywhere I have ever been.

Except... whoah.  IT IS GETTING COLD.  And... yeah.. I took the stairs too fast.  Hufffff* * Puffff* *.  Sheesh.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I feel so amazingly lucky to live in a city as diverse and beautiful as San Francisco. 

Parts of this city really give you that city feel- hustling and bustling, taxis, tall buildings, a myriad of cheap eats line the street blocks. 

Other parts, such as Land's End Trail, give you that country feel. If there is a warm and sunny day in your near future, do yourself a favor and experience Land's End Trail. It's a gorgeous, long walk, with breathtaking views of San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge.

Tip: Stop by Angelina's on 22nd and California before the walk and pick up some gourmet snacks. Bring water!
author: Laura D.

description: Absolutely gorgeous, easy walk and if you can find it... (we passed it the first walk) the labyrinth is a treasure cove.
author: Milly S.

description:
Lovely and easy -- something you can take friends from out of town on, even if they're out of shape.

The side trails are nice, both the ones that go down to the beach, and the ones that go up to the old gun emplacements near the VA hospital. If you work up an appetite while walking, you've got good choices for food at either end: Clement Street to the East and Cliff House / Park Chalet to the West.
author: Karsten P.

description:
Really lovely mini-hike on the Coastal Trail that's great for both a kick-back hike (mostly flat, with some paved areas) and somewhat strenuous hiking (as many folks have noted, there are lots of stairs on the offshoot trails, and to get down to the water can be quite steep).

But the main reason to go is for the beautiful views of the Marin Headlands and the Golden Gate Bridge.  If you look hard enough, you can check out a few remnants of shipwrecks too.  Highly recommend checking out the labyrinth down Mile Rock trail that sits on the edge of a cliff. 

The Seacliff neighborhood that bookends one end of the trail has some beautiful houses to admire as well.
author: saudade s.

description:
If I'm going to go for a walk, this is a good place.  There are great views but there are also joggers who think they have the right of way over walkers and like to bowl into people.  That, and I don't get particularly excited when some says, "Wanna go for a walk!"

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description:
Super easy 2 mile hike from Merrie Way to China Beach along the Coastal Route. There is 1 long set of stairs midway through, and there are small up and downhills, nothing that can't be conquered.

You get to see 3 landmarks on this route- Sutro Baths, GG Bridge, and China Beach. Beautiful views, great getaway. 

Lots of dogs, a bunch that weren't leashed. 

Parking is available at both Point Lobos Ave before Ocean Beach and China Beach and it's FREE! 

Beautiful views, great getaway; would definitely take friends here :)
author: Jenny L.

description: my favorite route to run as the views and fresh air are amazing, The run isnt super long and also has various stairs and uphills to help vary the pace. Although they made some of the scenes into a big parking lot now, its still a good place to run when you're in shape or out of shape. Theres also a labyrinth (http://paganwiccan.about.com/od/sacredplaces/p/LandsEndLabyrin.htm)
author: Robert Y.

description:
Love it here. It's a nice, paved trail with amazing views of the Golden Gate Bridge. Makes you forget that you're still in the city, with all the trees and small animals scurrying around. It's a great place to get away for a while, just make sure you bring a jacket-it gets pretty cold once the sun goes down. 
And if you're directionally challenged like me, they have the occasional sign directing you to various hot spots nearby.
author: Nadia A.

description:
Lands End Trail is one of the quickest ways to get away from the city. There are plenty of places to spot the Golden Gate Bridge and scenic ocean views. The trail is pretty easy. Lands End Trail is smooth with a fair amount of stairs at certain points. The only part that might be troublesome for less physically able people and young children would be the route down to the rocky beach area. This area provides the best view of the Golden Gate Bridge and beach rocks. Currently some of the stairs are blocked off by yellow tape. Just follow the detour sign to a narrow side trail. Be cautious because there are no stairs or guide rails. You could just bypass this area to continue on the trail. Altogether it's about an hour hike if you just hike briskly straight through. But if it's your first time you'll most likely spend a couple of hours to take in the wonderful views (especially if you take the detour).

Note: This trail is not a loop. I ended on the other side and had to hike up near the golf courses. This is a bit steep so I recommend retracing the trail to get back to the parking lot.
author: Michael H.

description: It was a great trail...very novice.  Great for a great stroll and to get away from the city.  love the view of the ocean....cant wait to go back
author: JAN I.

description:
This is my favorite place in all of San Francisco.  I love it here, you can waste a whole day in another world, then walk back up and you're in the hustle and bustle of metropolitan San Francisco again. 
I recommend taking out of towners here, walking to the collapsed bathroom way up the beach and showing them the best view of the bridge from the south side.
There's the best marine life here as well because there aren't a ton of tourists messing with the shells.
Plus, it's a fun hike with some amazing graffiti art hidden on the destructed structures out here.
God I miss this park, even after my dog got sprayed by a skunk and we had to drive him back down town and live with him in a small apartment, it still is the most beautiful place in the Bay.
author: Jill H.

description:
One of my fondest memories is from a visit to Land's End. It was about 3.5 years ago and my sweet dog was still pretty spunky back then and loved to come on long walks with us. We took him to Land's End and he was such a trooper!  He kept up with us on one of the steep trails down to the water. Once we made it to the beach, he took off like a little bunny and started to run in circles right at the water's edge until he couldn't run anymore!  We laughed so hard, I think I was crying!  Now my little buddy is too old for those activities, but the memory will stay with me forever.

This is one of my favorite places in the city (and the state, oh hell...the whole country, okay!). It's so beautiful. The views of the ocean, bay, Marin Headlands, and GG bridge will blow you away. It's a great place to come when you're feeling overwhelmed by the chaos of the city. It reminds me that we live in one of the most beautiful, scenic parts of the country. 

Everybody will love it here. You don't have to be a super-athlete or hiker (I'm not!). You can take a leisurely walk or make it more of a challenge and head down to the water. For a real treat, bring lunch and enjoy it on one of the benches at the beginning of the trail. 

Enjoy it!
author: Abby W.

description:
If you like to hike and not up for anything very serious then this trail is perfect for you. Its very picturesque and has plenty of areas to wander off and get lost in. The fog can play a role but on a nice sunny day with that fresh ocean breeze coming up it can be spectacular. 

If you have time make sure to venture into the Legion of Honor as well. its a very nice distraction from the hike and gives you a little break.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Generally, I try not to run.  

Land's End Trail is one of the few places that makes running bearable.
author: Evan A.

description: Beautiful Trail - weather was perfect. The coastal trail - the one we did - isnt that long - should be able to do it in less than an hour with Sutro Bath add on included.
author: Ashish B.

description:
One of my two favorite running/hiking trails in the Bay Area. The other one is Strawberry Canyon trail in the Berkeley hills. The spectacular views of the sunset, the ocean, the Bridge, the Marin headlands, the rocks, and the trees and flowers, always give me that extra boost of energy to keep me running forward.

The running trail offers all kinds of terrain to suit your taste - flat dirt paths, steep up and down hills, dangerous cliff edges, through the forest.

For months my goal had been to run through those long and steep uphill steps at about the midpoint of the trail without having to slow down to a crawl to catch my breath. And I am proud to say, three weeks ago, I finally did it!! :))
author: Float C.

description:
This is a beautiful trail where you'll see views that look like they're off a post card around every turn.

Strange new find... one of the trails leads to a beach and large labrinth of stones by the ocean.

The city has cleared away large parts of it at the beginning of the trail in recent months which is very disturbing, but it still can't get less than 5 stars.
author: Shannon W.

description: This is such a wonderful trail! We went today and had a great time. The views are amazing (some of the best views of the Golden Gate Bridge), it's easily accessible, and parking was no problem. We took our dog and she also loved it! If you are looking for an easy hike with beautiful views, than this hike is for you!
author: Rachelle F.

description:
Lands End is one of the most preternaturally spectacular places in the world. The vistas, the fragrant diversity of the flora and fauna, the sound of the ocean rhythmically crashing into the cliffs and of wind rustling the trees, the soaring of hawks, pelicans, crows, and today an eagle - sublime. 
BUT the trail is populated by too many selfish, arrogant idiots who lack consideration for anything outside of themselves. For example, the moron riding his bike along the part of the trail that is populated by 'no biking' signs; I told him and he said he knows, but he wants to ride there anyway. The people whose dogs run wild into the sensitive habitat, some of it endangered, digging and pooping wherever the dogs wish, and whose owners retaliate with 'it's none of your f-ing business' when I politely point out that dogs must remain on the trail. I love dogs, but not their inconsiderate owners. The people smoking, when the air is so fresh and fragrant with wilderness. Why must people overstep their bounds? Why not just absorb and settle into nature, to allow it to transform each of us? And yes, as another reviewer commented, though I don't think tourists are solely guilty of this, the people who won't yield or walk on the proper side of the trail, taking up as much space as their egos demand.
Hence I give Lands End four stars, and lament that people aren't more sensitive to the world around them, for this place is to celebrated, not trampled upon.
author: Eliza S.

description:
I really love this trail. If you're a gym body but not that athletic (like me and every Jessica Alba wanna-be), this place would be great for you. It is pretty challenging for a run and extremely serene for a walk. It has great views of the Golden Gate Bridge! Try it once and you will go back. 

Plenty of parking, a bit hard to find the first time, lots of dogs and tourists on the weekend, and a good escape from the busy city.
author: Emily F.

description:
Minus One Star for not being as long as I would like.  

Overall, the view of the Golden Gate Bridge is spectacular! The panoramic view of the ocean got me missing Hawaii's Diamond Head Hike.  The ocean isn't as blue as the tropical islands but I went on a day where the view was clear and the weather is perfect - cool breeze w/the sun beaming a cast of light on the ocean waters.

Originally I gave this a four star trail, but I hiked w/someone very special so I have to put that one star back up there because it made it that much more fun and memorable.  Yes... I recommend bringing that significant other.  We found cool things, from a stuck jellyfish, to a cave, to a labyrinth... to hmm.. i don't know.. go find out! it'll be fun!
author: Shenni C.

description:
Ah yes, Land's End.  If you want to get 'away from it all' without leaving the city, this is the place.  Beautiful views of the ocean, the Golden Gate and the bay.  Take a detour down to Mile Rock Beach and check out some amazing tide pools.

A great way to spend a weekend morning.
author: Mark G.

description:
This trail is so beautiful to me in so many ways I can't even begin to describe it without getting choked up. Ok so I'm being overly dramatic, but not as dramatic as the many  twists and turns and Ooos and Ahhhs you'll be sighing with each new glimpse of San Francisco shoreline and perspectives of the Golden Gate Bridge. It can get a little chilly on this trail because of the shaded areas but when it's a beautiful sunny day in the city this is the ideal place to go and run, hike and walk your troubles away.  It provides a great workout with the many level changes by way of stairs, dirt hills and flat areas, and if you hustle it could take about 20-30 minutes to do the entire thing and end up over by the Cliff House (which is a great stop for a bathroom break!)  On the way you find yourself with many options to diverge off the road and go explore the Lincoln Park golf course or Mile Rock beach, or even the Veteran's Hospital if that sort of thing compels you.  You can make this walk leisurely or intense just by slowing down or speeding up your pace, so this trail really caters to whatever your needs of the day are. 

It gets pretty crowded on beautiful days and on the weekends. Expect that and just be patient but option 2 is to go walk around Seacliff and gawk at rich people's houses.
author: Emiko T.

description: Holy Guacamole!  This trail blew my socks off.  What a surprise!  I had no idea this existed and then a friend of mine brought me there for a special Saturday!  There is no place in the world like this.  The green cliffs dropping right down into the Pacific, with the views of the breath taking Golden Gate bridge, mountains, birds chirping...amazing!  THIS IS A MUST!  Enjoy!
author: Melissa E.

description: This place is saaweeet!  I've gone a couple times and been almost alone...sort of a transcendental bliss.  Very beautiful, though often windy.
author: Rob C.

description:
I love this park! there are lovely trails with gorgeous views of the ocean, bridge and city. A short distance to travel and you feel like you are in another world. So pretty, always restores my spirit. 

And if you are feeling like doing something cultural, you can walk up to the Legion of Honor and walk through the museum. They also have a cafe if you are hungry.
author: Lisa H.

description: This really makes you appreciate the bay. You go from city to beautiful forests and the ocean in just a few minutes. There are many trails you can go off and be alone at. The main trail is pretty busy. Lot's of tourists here. Steep hills on some of the trails. Lands End Trail itself goes pretty far; it's quite a walk. I like to go find a spot by myself and listen to the ocean crash against the rocks. It can be quite breathtaking!
author: Chris I.

description:
I FREAKIN LOVE THIS TRAIL!!!!

it had an amazing view throughout the entire hike.  there's a point where you have to climb up like a million (i'm exaggerating) stairs but it's totally fun. 

i can't wait to hike this trail again and this time bring a picnic cause its a great place to have a picnic and see the view. definitely one of the best trails in the city. 

love love love
author: Jodi P.

description:
If you're looking for a super-intensive hike, this isn't it -- you should stick to climbing the streets around the center of the city or head north to Mt. Tam.

If you're looking for gorgeous views, a little peace and quiet, a way to connect with nature without leaving the city, and a few points of historical interest -- this is the trail for you.  It is a sublimely pretty area, and I really have to commend SF Parks and Rec for doing such an incredible job on the upkeep.  The trails have undergone a lot of renovations to ensure that they are safe as well as lovely.  There's also decent free parking, and Muni line 18 comes here. 

A great place to take out-of-town visitors who think cities are only about shopping and eating.
author: Deidre B.

description:
One of my favorite spots in San Francisco, with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge, the Marin headlands and the mystifying Pacific, Lands End reminds you why it's good to be alive. 

Bring out of town guests here to experience the ocean. Great any time but better at sunset. BEST at sunset.
author: Jessica M.

description:
The view of downtown from Alamo Square is epic, but you will fall in love with San Francisco in a whole other way.

It's worthwhile to do the hike down the stairs to the view of the entire bay.

Sometimes I'll run Land's End, through the Presidio to Crissy Field and back - long run but it's a way to get the miles with phenomenal views and terrain.
author: E L.

description: Simply beautiful. Must must do - so much better than going to crowded touristy Crissy fields to catch a glimpse of golden gate and the ocean.
author: Carol L.

description:
So great, every time I come I wonder why I don't get to Land's End more often.  Took a great walk/stroll/hike on the trail on Saturday afternoon.  The weather was beautiful, it was a clear day, the views of the Bay, the Bridge and the Pacific were spectacular.

Lots of easy parking.  Amazingly some joggers running by.  Awesome to take your time and enjoy the views.  SF doesn't get any better than this.
author: Aaron T.

description:
One of San Francisco's hidden treasure and it's in my own backyard!  This is perfect for just about any fitness level and the view is just amazing.  You get an awesome picture of the Golden Gate Bridge as well as the bay.  I've been here on numerous occasion - whether running the trails or sitting quietly meditating, its great to just getaway sometimes.  

FYI - If you go further down, closer to the water - you can find a huge rock you can sit on right in the water.  Waves crashing and everything...
author: Julie H.

description: Easy to get to lost when riding a bike, the reason being, many of the trails do not allow bikes.  So getting to your desired location may have some detours.  I think it's better to run here than to bike here.
author: Roger H.

description:
I have a general belief that a beach is not a beach if it's super, bloody cold there.  Well, SF seems to only have cold shorelines and sadly I don't go to them very often.  Land's End Trail is one of the only thing that gets me excited about the beach hear.

I have taken out of town visitors for this trail hike many a time and everyone is always amazed that this is really a part of SF.  It's such a beautiful park and trail.  The route that I take ends in a glorious view of the bay, our most famous red bridge, and a certain cliff landmark that I dare not name.  You'll just have to discover it for yourself.

It's a great place to get some cardio out, meditate, picnic, or just enjoy some fresh air without noise or air pollution.  This is one of those places that I will always cherish!
author: Augie S.

description:
My absolute favorite spot in the city.  Incredible views that can be dramatically different every time.  It is an escape from the urban chaos into nature without having to leave the city limits.

Staying on the trail, the hike is relatively easy.  If you are up for more of a challenge, you can hike down to the water which offers even more breathtaking views of the Pacific.

The trail is dog friendly, kid friendly, and certain segments (especially the paved side closer to the cliff house), are wheelchair accessible (I think).  A quick note of caution is to be careful going off trail... especially after heavy rains.  There are many steep drops.

Before heading to Marin headlands or other far away hiking spots, check out this gem we have in the city (but don't tell too many people!)
author: Zoe H.

description:
Around 10 years ago, I was hiking on the Land's End trail and decided to get off the beaten path and hike down to the beach around dusk. There used to be a military ruin down there, and while I was exploring it, some creepy dude propositioned me. He basically  cornered me while I was in the old building and asked me if I wanted to "play". I told him I wasn't interested, and he left. Hiking back alone in the dark left me feeling a bit vulnerable.

I hadn't hiked along the Land's End trail in years. The trail is far more developed now, and the NPS even built a proper trail leading down to the beach. Sadly, the ruins have since been further destroyed by the sea.

Watch out for poison oak!
author: J K.

description:
What a great hike down the mile rock staircase and to the bottom!

do the loop  - coastal trail to el camino del mar..

we are so lucky to live in such a beautiful place ;-)
author: Jippers C.

description: Super views of the Golden Gate Bridge, surfers, & dolphins. Nice trail leading to Sutro Bath remains & Cliffhouse restaurant.  You can also get on this trail from the Legion of Honor, but it is a bit tricky to find the trail because of the Golf Course in between. You will be sharing the path with the Golf course in the beginning. As you are facing the Legion of Honor entrance, look to the right and you'll see a memorial with Japanese writing. At that trail, you want to go down that hill and then go left up the hill and that will lead to the trail. It is best to look at this in Google maps Satellite view with labels.
author: Ria J.

description: Sweet trail. Short and simple. 30 mins to Cliffhouse, 30 mins back. Great for getting out and getting the blood flowing.
author: Jon C.

description:
I hated running - I even took dance in high school so that I wouldn't have to run the mile. This trail changed all of that nonsense. This is what started what is now a crazy running (albeit very slow running) obsession.  

Honestly, beach, trail and trees practically in my back yard- yeah it rocks! It's never too crowded and you get to enjoy awesome views of the GG Bridge. It's what gets my butt outta bed real early on a Saturday morning.
author: Lauren D.

description: If you are looking for a secluded hike....this is not the place for you. Very beautiful, and would be more "magical" if you were discovering this with out a million tourist posing in front of the "cinematic" landscape.
author: Soraya A.

description: Even for a city gal like me, coastal vistas are definitely appreciated! It's close to my house, so that's a plus...but that also means I (or you) don't get away from the fog factor. This detracted from my time a bit, but it's worth a visit if you need a break from traffic, noise, and the like. Pretty scenics are even prettier with a friend!
author: Liv B.

description: So nice to have a "hike" ("   " because it's not very challenging -- more of a walk) accessible from within the city via public transit! Great place to take out-of-town visitors.
author: Sarah B.

description: lived here all my life and didn't do the entire trail until recently... what?! so glad i did though. i think this trail is a favorite among tourists and locals alike. why? you can get some great expansive views of the bay and golden gate bridge, plus it's an easy "hike." it's actually just a wonderful walk and it was great to see families, children, and dogs all sharing the trial on a sunny, windless, sunday afternoon. i hope this trail will be enjoyed by all for generations to come!
author: Erin M.

description:
This is a fantastic trail. A must see. The views of GG are wonderful, and if you're lucky enough to come on a sunny day then the views are heaven on earth. The trail certainly isn't as narrow as some people have described on here. And for the person that complained that this place is a tourist trap and too exposed, need I remind you this is public land for ALL to enjoy. You can't own San Francisco and just because you think something is enjoyable, doesn't mean you deserve it all to yourself. Everyone should be able to enjoy a beautiful place like this. If it wasn't for the park service maintaining it or buying it, it'd remain run down like it was in the 80s and people were getting murdered out there! Plus who'd want a private developer to get their hands on it and put up a hotel( or mansions?), then you'd really be complaining about tourists! That's like a 98 year old saying they hate all the people that have moved here over the last 50 years, and you're one of them! I mean what do you think the people that walked there before you think about all that came after?
    So go enjoy people! SF is a wonderful place to visit and so is this trail!
author: Adrian P.

description:
If you can, go during a week day. Preferably before 1 o'clock.

If you have the time, take the side path down to Mile Rock Beach. It is a very terrific place with some oddly beautiful fallen pieces of home that are now covered in graffiti. Just remember you have to walk 100 stairs or so back up.
author: Mickey S.

description:
I found this trail over a year ago in a book I have on SF walks. Quickly realized it is one of San Francisco's best kept secrets! It must be somewhat of a secret, because even on beautiful summer weekend days, there is plenty of free parking still available...how amazing is that? Anyway, I have come back again and again. It's also a great place to bring folks who are visiting SF.

The first time I walked this trail, it took my breath away with the gorgeous views of the bay and the Golden Gate bridge. You get to those views pretty much immediately! It's a fairly easy walk, although if you go far enough you get to a moderately long set of stairs. Also, there is a side trail down to Mile Beach that also involves a decent number of stairs (totally worth it...check out the starfish and mussels on the rocks at the beach). At the far end of the trail I always turn it into a loop by going up to the road (El Camino del Mar?) and walk back past the golf course and the Palace of the Legion of Honor. Then I go to the far end of the Legion of Honor parking lot to pick up the trail again. The first time I did this walk, there was a huge Chihuly sculpture "Sun" just outside of the Legion of Honor - it was just another unexpected burst of pleasure that day. As was the "little fennel forrest", which I call the area where there is a ton of wild fennel, much of it 8 feet tall. After I finish the loop towards the GG bridge, I may do a small loop in the other direction, towards the Sutro Baths and the Cliff House. This is fun especially if I'm bringing out-of-town visitors. At the end of this ~2-3 hour walk, the Cliff House is a convenient place with restrooms (yay!) and to consider for a meal (although I've only ended up actually eating here once).
author: yolanda y.

description: Just an amazing walk, it just has this affect and makes you forget that your in the city. The trail just winds around with it's ups and downs allowing for great views of the Golden Gate. I liked the little fact posts that were displayed along the trail. Who knew that there so many wrecks off that point. A definite must for any local and any visitor.
author: Roberto F.

description: This makes SF unique since we are not far from nice trails like this. My running started here. It's nice.
author: Brock L.

description:
I usually hop on this trail at 32nd and El Camino Del Mar. This part of the trail is the closest to my dwelling place. I am oh so lucky to have this trail near by...and let me tell you why...

It's a beautiful day and I'm running along this trail while being capitivated by the amazing views. Am I really in San Francisco? Oh yeah I am! There's the Golden Gate Bridge. How beautiful it looks peaking out through the cypress trees! I'm running along and I'm so happy because my sneakered feet are not pounding into concrete but on this shady dirt trail. I look over and see the ocean. I start planning my next bike ride as I catch a glimpse of the Marin Headlands. Off to the side of the main trail are trails that lead down to the beach. You can actually trek down there and run along the beach if you are feeling it. But, I decide to stay on the main trail. I round a corner and a picture perfect view of the vast Pacific Ocean spreads out before me. If I'm lucky, I can catch a glimpse of dolphins or even a gray whale. But, it appears I won't glimpse any sea creatures today. I jog up the hardest part of the trail which are steep steps that go straight up and then leads you back down onto a wider trail. 

The end of the trail spits you out on Point Lobos near the old Sutro Baths and the Cliff House. You can call someone to pick you up or you can turn around and head back to 32nd and El Camino Del Mar, where you began. If you decide to turn around; then you just hiked, ran, or walked a 3 mile round trip.

I'm running along this trail with my Ipod and I'm completely carried away by the views and my music. 

"breathe in breathe out 
breathe in breathe out 
breathe in 

deaf dumb and thirty 
starting to deserve this 
leaning on my conscience wall 
blood is like wine 
unconscious all the time 
if i had it all again 
i'd change it all"

I love this trail! Oh no, oh no! I watch my Ipod fly through the air as I fall towards the ground. Ahem, watch out for the rocks or crevices on the path...they just LIKE come out of no where!

OVERALL: Secret trails abound off this wonderful trail. My favorite marked trails are Mile Rock to the Labyrinth and Painted Rock. Meditation perfected in these quiet spots next to the water.
author: Liz K.

description: Amazing! I love dropping by for a walk here. You can find the trail from the legion of honor, just watch for golf balls! The whole loop probably takes at least an hour.
author: Amanda S.

description:
hiking and dating are fairly similar experiences. land's end is like a good lover to me; always something beautiful to behold, just difficult enough to traverse, and i am rewarded with new discoveries through each cliff and crag.

navigating through a new trail is like going on those first few dates. the giddiness and excitement of something new, taking much more cautious steps initially and the time to stop, examine and memorize the small details of the journey. sometimes, i expect to find other people on the same journey, on this same route. and oftentimes i know i am the only one. the masculine pungency of pine needles; the salty sea spray like a tickle of lips on skin. 

if a trail is too easy, i tend not to come back to it. mastering a trail on the first go will only make me think twice about coming back. the challenges arouse, and i have a spirit for adventure. i want my trails to have enough complexity to always lead me somewhere new. i want my chest to heave, my skin to glisten with sweat, my breath quick and deep.

excitement. the thrill of a steep hill, the slip on a boulder on the shore. sometimes falling yet never permanent scars. just a nick here or there to remind me i am human, i bleed and i have been hurt before. 

i see the footprints of others who have walked here before, and sometimes am disappointed with the refuse of so many before me. i carry my pack which ultimately becomes a depository for this litter as i come to love a place so i shall also be its keeper. i should like to say i apply the same tenderness and understanding in life.

the moment of pure bliss. sunset over the pacific, warm orange glow against the mountains to the north and the brick red gate. the sound of waves rhythmically lapping the shore. very few things can compare to this site. the soul feels full like when i am touched by love. 

stand too still in one place for too long, and the chill in the air eats down to the bone. so i always move forward. and moving forward creates warmth again, and the cycle is repeated until the end.
author: May T.

description:
This is where I find my mind.

Ignore the signs that tell you danger is ahead.  As long as you're not hanging on the side of a cliff, it's generally safe when you venture up that dirt hill or past the makeshift fence that screams, "Please, walk right over me!" 

On a nice weekend, there are painters along the trail, some of them have coffee for you.  

Again, I recommend exploring the uncharted path here.  Much more rewarding. 

Beautiful in any weather at any time.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Thank you for all the lovely walks... No matter the day, the hour, the weather, you never disappoint!
author: Heidi L.

description: Thank you, you make me feel truly grateful to be alive. And to live in this amazing city. Thank you.
author: S F.

description:
Love this walk, but a word to the wise stay away at dusk.  Too many creepy dudes crusing for some action and lurking in the bushes.

Creeps aside, the walk is gorgeous.  The views incredible, beach access is fun.
author: Diana B.

description: You'll feel like you're at the edge of the world, balancing on a tiny trail over the ocean, dangling above sheared cliffs and walking among wind-bent trees. Across the water, Marin. Before you, the open Pacific and the setting Sun. This is the most place to go when you want to reinvigorate your soul.
author: Andrew K.

description: Views for every moment of this walk.  When the weather's right (or wrong, depending), I love coming back into civilization after being wind-whipped by this place.  You get that "I've been through the harsh wilderness and survived" kind of feeling, even though you were just easily strolling through a well groomed and varied path.  Lovely.
author: Jennifer B.

description: What a nice walk on a pretty day.  We walked all the way down to the water and then out along the overlook and back in. The weather was great, the views were great, and the people watching was great.  What more can you want?
author: kate m.

description: Yup, still a moderate hike.  This place is truly soul-stirring.  I thought it was just me, romanticizing the beauty of this hike.  But really--- it's not.  I went here today with a friend that needed some good decompression time.  And boy oh boy, he was surprised at least a few times.  this screams a true testiment to how magical this place can be.  i had a great time picking mussels from those mussel beds (had to clime down to the "do not enter for your safety" area).  and I definitely pushed myself physically... with all the real hiking we did alongside the sutro bath hills.  Took some time to be adventurous and sat right at the edge of cliffs.......  Now that I think about it... maybe I shouldn't have done all those scary and death-defying scenary/adrenaline climbs.  BUT!!!!  you'd sure be missing out if you didn't.  Awesome times one thousand.
author: Rainbow B.

description: A great trail to enjoy that is close and convenient.  Try this trail when you want to go for an easy, beautiful and rewarding hike, but only have a few hours to spare.
author: Jack H.

description: On a clear, warm day, this place is heaven! Breathtaking view of the Golden Gate Bridge on one end, the stretch of cliffs, sea and coastal vegetation in between, and the Sutro Baths/Ocean Beach on the other end. You can even access the beautiful Legion of Honor from this trail. It's a short, but rigorous run thanks to the killer stairs in the middle. But I swear by those stairs because they keep this booty in bangin' shape! Definitely a great escape from fast-paced city life. I suggest treking out here on the weekend for a run/walk from east to west so you end at the Cliffhouse for brunch. Just goes to show how much San Francisco has to offer.
author: Natalie T.

description: The trail is very close to the city, but still nicely tucked away from the hustle and bustle of urban life. It has excellent coastal views of the Pacific Ocean, the beaches, and Golden Gate Bridge. I have been there multiple times and twice I have spotted a school of dolphins swimming along the coast. This trail starts off paved, but long enough for my boyfriend, who is on a wheelchair, to enjoy the scenic view. I was so excited to find another place for me and my boyfriend to enjoy together.
author: Rosalyn R.

description: I had a romantic walk here with my BF... and his friend.  The views were amazing, and I fulfilled my duty as a good tourist by snapping lots of photos. Got plenty of pics with my BF and his friend!  But, for some reason, none with me and my BF...
author: Julie H.

description: Standing on the edge of the country, one would expect it to incredible. However, I was not prepared for the sublime reality that is Land's End Trail. Finding it while walking to a friend's house, I didn't expect a trail with the same name as a lame clothing brand to wow me. I was in for a huge surprise. This trail is one of the most breathtaking local park trails I've ever been on. I've seen my share of natural sites, but this view and surrounding trees made my soul fly. I highly recommend it to anyone!! It's not too strenuous. It might be a little drive/muni ride for those not in the Richmond/Seacliffe are but it is well worth it!!
author: Greg H.

description: There are a lot of things I adore about the Outer Richmond, not least of them being this trail. It is stunning, and great for running and hiking, and even when it's VERY early, foggy, and cold, it's amazing to see the fog covered GG bridge and the beautiful ocean. I never liked to run, but trails like this make it not only bearable, but enjoyable! If you haven't checked it out, you must. It 's gorgeous!
author: Bridgette A.

description: Best place to take a short walk/"hike" in San Francisco. Gorgeous views all the way around of Marin headlands and the bridge (especially now that they've removed some of the bushes/trees in certain spots).  You can even see some sea lions at the bottom of a cliff half way around the trail (just after the 200 stairs if you're heading east).   Nice way to feel like you're getting out of the city without actually leaving it.
author: Jen D.

description: This has been on my "San Francisco To Do List" since I moved here in December.  I finally got my butt over here a couple week ago.  We started at the Legion of Honor and went down to the Baths.  It was definitely one of the most beautiful views of San Francisco I have seen.  The hike itself is pretty simple but it gives you so many great lookouts.  It really is amazing to have a place like this in the city.  Oh and you can take the Geary bus straight there!
author: Kate J.

description: One of my favorites.  Not as secluded as it used to be and part of the trail has been fixed up, but its very pretty and I love the Legion of Honor area and views!
author: Peter S.

description:
land's end is by far one of my favorite places in san francisco.  it blows me away that scenery and beauty like this can be found in an urban location.  i've been coming to this trail for years to run, to explore, to escape and to exhale.  i take out of town visitors here all the time to brag about the gorgeous city i'm fortunate enough to live in.  land's end offers sweeping views of the golden gate bridge and the headlands as well as the opportunity to get away from city life to take advantage of beautiful, native flora.  a mist see for sure!!

word of advice: bring a jacket, even if you have to just wrap it around your waist.  it can get a little chilly on the water.
author: andrea g.

description: Beautiful trail.  The views of the Golden Gate are wonderful!  Love taking the doggie off the leash to explore and run around!  A really good place to just enjoy the crisp, fresh air and wind down from the hustle of the city.
author: Tysen C.

description: One of the most beautiful hidden parts of San Francisco, this trail is simply gorgeous. Just past the Legion of Honor you can find yourself literally at land's end with the ocean stretching out in front of you all the way to Japan. This is definitely one of my favorite places in the city with breathtaking views of the ocean, trees, the Marin headlands, Baker beach and a rock beach. Sunny or cloudy the view will leave you in awe.
author: Cathy T.

description: One of the best in city hikes around. Don't fall off the cliff.
author: James B.

description: I want to give this 10 stars.  What an awesome trail for the view and varying terrains.  We took our kids under 7 and they loved it.  You can spend hours on the trail, taking detours down to the ocean and other vista points.  This is a must for all visitors near and far.
author: N B.

description:
Sunday afternoon I went on an amazing hike through the Lands End Trail, which happens to be in my backyard! I started off by the Sutro Baths and made my way about a mile down the trail. The views and plant life along the entire trail were gorgeous! The rocky ocean, the green cliff side, and a perfect view of the Golden Gate Bridge. When I began the hike I had no idea I would be seeing the Golden Gate Bridge, so it was a great surprise when I turned that corner and got the best view in the whole city of the beautiful bridge and all the passing ships and sailboats. At the end of the mile I sat along the edge of the cliff (safely!) and ate a packed lunch and enjoyed the clear skies and warm air. There were plenty of people along the path, but with the perfect weather and amazing views I would have expected more. This is definitely the best spot in San Francisco and I will be going back as often as possible. To see some pics I took and a bit more of my review check out http://www.sanfrancisconoobs.com/07-13-2009/lands-end-trail-san-francisco-ca/
p.s. the trail is dog friendly
author: Casi C.

description: Great trail. we took our dog here and she loved it. off leash seemed OK especially down at the beach. This trail has some of the best views in the city. if you are a local you need to check it out.. if you are a tourist then this is a must see.
author: Brian K.

description: I found these trails while running from OB to the Cliff House.  A little boy was standing on the cliff behind the platform, below him the water was crashing and churning onto the rocks and the bay was in the distance.  It was a stunning day; it made me thankful that I got to stay in the Richmond.
author: Emily J.

description: One of San Francisco's hidden treasures. We absolutely loved the scenic and serene hike at Land's End. It is a really easy hike about 3.4 miles round trip. You can easily walk or run this trail. The point I recommend to start is at Point Lomos near 48th. There are two FREE parking lots right before you wind down to reach The Cliff House. The trail starts at the parking lot. You can take the steps down to the Sutra bath. The view is awesome and you will find a lil cave that is cozy and romantic. The trail is very easy to follow. You can also find a map at www.everytrail.com. You will see beautiful views of the vast ocean, Marin county and the Golden Gate bridge! There is a spot for Mile point beach and there are stairs that take you down. Once you go down and to the right, you go up a lil hill to get to the labyrinth! Hold your breath. It is not a huge maze but a lil one drawn up on the ground. Here you will find yourself closer to GG bridge. Once you are done, u have to remember to go back the way you came, back to those stairs as that's the only way to get back on the trail! There are lots of warnings about people falling off cliffs but you will be fine as long as u stay safe and away from the edges. Overall, the hike was great and on a sunnier day, it would be 5 stars. The views are unbeatable. For a quick easy trail this is one at the top!
author: Jayashree S.

description: Thank you yelpers, I wouldn't have found LET without you!  Scenic gorgeous trail with views of Golden Gate and waves crashing into the cliff below..  Runners, walkers even bikers share the trails nicely, expect some stairs and slight climbs but even novice hikers can enjoy this trail the views and the sounds of the ocean are a great break from the city scene.
author: Ariana P.

description:
This place is BEAUTIFUL! It's definitely the place to be when you want to enjoy the scenery while eating your lunch or exercising. There are several different paths you can take which can lead you down to the beach or up in the hills or looking over cliffs. 
We started at Sutro Baths and explored the cool cave down there, although there wasn't much exploring necessary. It was exciting though because it was dark and scary. Then we walked along the coastal trail and the view was amazing! There's little signs and podiums with interesting facts about shipwrecks, etc along the way. We headed down to Mile Rock Beach and then up towards the Labyrinth. We walked along the cliffs and then got to Eagle's Point. We continued on the path until there was a closure in the trail for maintenance, then walked back to Sutro Baths.
It was a pretty leisurely walk but the killer were the STAIRS! Man, my legs were killing me after going up all the stairs at Sutro Baths and Mile Rock Beach.
Also, the people walking on the trails are so NICE! Many of them said "Hi!" and others would start conversations about the scenery out of the blue.
I can't wait to go back and take other trails!
author: Lee N.

description: Land's End Trail is beautiful.  My husband and I were amazed to find such an amazing view Land's End has to offer.  After visiting the city it was a beautiful discovery. It was an incredible way to spend a Sunday morning.  The city has done a really good job taking care of it.  Go early to find parking!
author: G B.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco. Here you can forget you're in a city. Incredibly scenic, lots of dope little trails off the beaten path.
author: Chris S.

description: I came here to do some martial arts training years ago with a teammate. I was new to SF at the time and was absolutely floored by how beautiful it is.   This place is beautiful and speaks volumes of how visually appealing San Francisco is and can be.  If you want to walk or run a trail solo, with friends, or your dog(s), this is definitely a place to experience.
author: Robert W.

description: Ryry and I started from Sutro Baths - Lands End - Eagles Point and then back the same path...I must say I enjoyed this hike very much (eventhough I'm out of shape), the scenery is amazing, and there's so much history to learn (I never knew places like this exist in San Francisco)...Next time I want to go beyond Eagles point to see "China Beach" and "Baker Beach" =)
author: Precious S.

description: Upon returning to my old city after 6 years, I headed straight to Land's End (literally from the airport in my rental car).  The sights, the smells, the unbelievable beauty took my breath away even more than it did the first time around.  San Francisco natives, be proud, enjoy, and don't ever take for granted.
author: Leigh-Anne L.

description: What an amazing corner of the city.  Rocky cliffs with grassy tops rise out of the bay giving rise to this beautiful headland.  With the leftover batteries of Fort Miley, the picturesque VA Hospital, and all of Ocean Beach within view, this is one of the most beautful walks I've taken in the city.  Bonus points if you're there for a sunset on a clear day, it's breathtaking.  Find a path off the main path and hike down to an overhanging rocky viewpoint for an amazing experience.  Also, it's conveniently located off the 38 and probably more routes on the northeast entry.
author: Eric S.

description: Simply a beautiful and easy walk and a great view of Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Bridge. Kid and dog friendly!
author: Liana C.

description: I will never get tired of this trail.  It is truly breathtaking and powerful to see... I don't want to overly rate this place, so please just see it for yourself and make your own judgement.  But I have to say out of all my hiking and running trails in SF this is #1.
author: M D.

description: Just another plug for this gorgeous trail - go, go, go!  They're doing some construction by the Sutro Baths and that parking lot (on Merrie Way), but there's another lot at Ft. Miley.  If you're walking/running, head into the trail at 48th Ave and El Camino Del Mar.  That paved path leads to a spectacular lookout point (easily accessible by all)...just makes me smile, no matter what mood I'm in!  The Coastal Trail is about 1.5mi, and that's where you hit the stairs and some rocky paths (difficult for my uncoordinated self).  The end of the trail drops you off at the Sea Cliff (or you could break off earlier and head towards Ft. Miley/VA/Legion of Honor).  Check this place out if you haven't...it's quite breathtaking and just a little off the beaten path.
author: Joyce L.

description: Took some friends visiting from LA here and since the regular parking lot was closed, we drove up and parked over here. I had never been on this side of the bay before and felt like I had found a treasure, it was so beautiful, peaceful, and not packed with tourists. It was more local residents walking their dogs and people jogging. The view of the golden gate and the bay and ocean were beautiful. If you walk to the left after you go down the stairs, you wind downhill for .2 miles and then you can see the Sutro Baths and the Cliff House on your left. It was a great little walk we did and I'm glad we found it.
author: Vivian L.

description: Went here today after reading great reviews on Yelp. One of my favorite places on Earth is the Marin Headlands, and this trail/park gave a completely different perspective of the Bay. It was beautiful and almost magical as we made our way all over the cliffs down and up and all around. Be sure to take a less beaten path and make your way all the way down to the water. And check out the rock maze. You can find shade and resting spots throughout. It can be quite the trek so be prepared with water. Great place to bring a picnic, watch the sunset, or just soul search. I highly recommend this place to everyone and anyone who wants some outdoor goodness.
author: Jessica F.

description: With daylight savings upon us, this would be my first choice for a convenient close hike that is literally 5 minutes away.  Those of us who live in the Richmond District of SF are always so thankful for the surrounding trails that encourage us to exercise.  I am one-of-those that does not have an ipod attached to their head, but instead chose to listen to the waves pounding, glimpse at the stillness of the water, the sun setting, the newly planted vegetation.  Except for the occasional "idiot" trying to bike the trail, it is a most pleasant way to end the day.  The trail itself is a 1.5 miles ( one way), but you can extend that many times over by hitting one of the side trails with stairs going down to the beach or the 125 stairs on the main trail.   What more can we ask for - a golf course on one side, "the trail" and the sound of the ocean on the other.
author: Kea C.

description: I've been hiking this trail for years. For years, it wasn't as heavily traveled & it was a best kept secret. Now there are a lot of people coming to hike along the cliffs. I usually try to hit it during the week and avoid the crowds during the weekend. My pooch loves this trail sooooo much. She'd like to explore this trail, everyday..if she could.
author: M M.

description: I love this little city hike. It's also fun to take visitors here because it seems so out of the city.  The 1 bus drops you off close to a little cafe so you can either end the hike in outer Richmond, or start there (my choice) then end up walking into the Marina. It's wonderful. Also a great running trail. On weekends there can be some real characters out here.
author: jen n.

description: I can't count how many happy afternoons I have spent on this trail in the past year. Living right at the start of the trail near Lincoln Park has given me much joy, able to enjoy much of the beauty the trail has to offer. As an environmental writer, reconnecting with nature is very important and, walking along Land's End, truly helps to keep me sane.
author: Victoria K.

description: This is the best trail in the city.... You can take your visitors there and they won't forget this gorgeous view of the bridge, the water and the mountains
author: Christine S.

description:
O! Land's End -- the cross country practice from hell (right below strawberry hill in the Park). However, the views compensated for the otherwise painful feelings of having a coach yelling at you to run up those never-ending stairs faster. It is a very good trail to run on though, and brings you from the Cliff House to the Sea Cliff / Lincoln Golf Course area. 

I returned long cross country season to walk my dog and got a whole new feeling. The trail walks (or runs) you through infinite panoramic views of the bay, the bridge, the beaches, and more. On a nice day, it's a great idea. It's amazing to realize that the hustle and bustle of downtown is simply minutes away. 

4 Stars. I would definitely return.
author: Danny D.

description: Lands End Trail is a great way to explore the coast while still in San Francisco.  It's very dog friendly!  We enjoy hiking from Cliff House down to Baker Beach and back with the dog.  He's happy, we're happy, everyone's happy.
author: Christina T.

description: Breathtaking views of the coast and Marin and one of the most beautiful spots in San Francisco!  It's a pretty easy trail but you can make it harder by running up/down some of the steps sprinkled throughout.  On a clear day, this trail should not be missed!  Even being out in the fog is kinda cool.
author: Cristina M.

description: A very decent hike, especially for me since I'm not a big hiker.  The man drove out to the city EARLY this morning so we were out at about 7:30AM.  There was hardly anyone on the trail, but it was foggy, cold, and misty.  I think if we had chosen to go on a clearer day, we could've appreciated the view more.  But even considering the weather, it's a really nice place to go to feel like you're away from the city when you're not.  Plus, it's pretty close to my house.
author: Kris L.

description: I feel so privileged to have discovered this trail. It offers an unimaginable view of the coast and edge of our wonderful city and is the prefect treat for a good day in the sun. I expect many more mornings spent exploring this area.
author: Alicia J.

description: The path runs close to the waters edge. On a clear day you can see crazy surfers climbing with their boards along the cliffs to get the best swells. I love the smell of the ocean here, especially at night.
author: Judy L.

description: On days when I am disheartened with San Francisco, I can go walk this trail and fall in love all over again. The view of the coast line is amazing over here.
author: Kimi W.

description: Spectacular views for a walk spot, really nice people using the trails, can be flat & hilly depending on which way you go. Best sunsets you'll find, but make sure you head out asap- trails can be tricky as it gets dark. Sometimes you just need some nature- this is a GREAT place to find it.
author: Rhubarb M.

description: This is such a great hike.  The view is amazing.  You hike right by the water and have a picturesque view of the bridge.  Not too tough.
author: Blu n.

description: A must-do activity for all your tourist friends & family that would enjoy basking in the scenic glory of SF.  An easy walk/hike that I like to start at the Legion of Honor and wind down to the Cliff House.  It feels a little more adventurous and undiscovered this way and it's nice to come out of the end of the trail to sweeping views of the beach and ocean.
author: Mstar P.

description: AWESOME natural beauty in the city showcased here. So much to explore with some amazing views. Have fun exploring and take a water bottle :)
author: Jen T.

description: I could be biased on this as I'm in the neighborhood but definitely awesome, awesome trail.  Of course it could be longer but the view is absolutely breathtaking.  Not everybody in the world can conveniently enjoy such a view everyday!
author: Syonora A.

description: Going to spots like Lands End underscores how amazing this area is and how lucky we are. The breathtaking views of coast and the flora/fauna (lots of indigenous plant life...shall I point them out?) are quintessential San Francisco.  You're not going to get a rigorous hike, but you'll be guaranteed a breath of fresh air type of morning/afternoon.
author: Janet C.

description: Seriously one of the best trails in San Francisco and the Bay Area for that matter.  Starting in Sea Cliff, you really get more than you can imagine on this trail.  Gorgeous views, varied terrain, vegetation of all sorts, and pretty incredible weather.  This is a great trail to take your friends to for a scenic tour, romantic for a brisk walk with your sweetie, and fantastic for a great work out.  The round trip is about 3 miles I believe, especially if you cross over to Sutro Park and check out Ocean Beach and the surfers.  There are definitely some more technical areas for footing and 2 sections with stairs, one is pretty extreme but nothing like Lyon Street.  The good news though is that if you're not trying to burn a few hundred calories, they're wide enough that you can go at your leisure enabling you to stop and enjoy the view.  The maintenance of this trail is stellar which is awesome considering it could be very muddy, rocky and overgrown.  And, to make it even better, they are constantly improving the trail by adding low retaining walls, walkways, overlooks to see the Golden Gate and even little portions of historical information.  When it's super hot, the tree cover keeps it cool, when it's foggy and chilly, the brisk walk warms up your blood, and even when it is drizzly, the trees give you momentary breaks.  At any time, it feels magical on this trail since it is so beautiful!  I truly love this trail and feel so lucky to have it in my city!!  Go out and enjoy it for yourself!
author: Cinds C.

description: For locals this trail is a sanctuary in the city!  Great for walking or hiking, gorgeous views (even on a foggy day) and not a lot of tourists to ruin it.  I could spend the entire day at Land's End and still have energy to visit Sutro Baths!
author: Daria i.

description: Words cannot describe..you just have to go there. beautiful, amazing, and more...Nature provides the best places to go..It's wonderful to have such a great hiking place in the city
author: Kyrsch K.

description: absolutely breathtaking! i guess the experience can depend a bit on the weather but most of the time its perfect. evertime i bring people from out of town here they LOVE IT. views of the pacific ocean and golden gate bridge as well as a cool ocean breeze you cant go wrong. parking isnt too tough and if you're hungry louis or the cliff house are right there. a MUST DO for tourists and locals alike.
author: Andrew D.

description: A great place to run and unwind after a long day.  Beautiful sites and sounds all around.
author: Emily W.

description: a beautiful place to go and take visitors.  bring a camera because the views are spectacular.
author: Big K R.

description: another sf gem.  a beautiful, scenic peaceful trail,  lined with trees& views of the pacific ocean, bay & golden gate bridge.  agreat place to walk, jog, de-stress, reflect, process, take the dog, breathe some fresh air, go alone, with a special partner, with a small group of friends, take out of towners who are into nature...................
author: Cindi N.

description: i saw a sign that sad "people have fallen to their death here" great way to start a hike!!! its really beautiful
author: Ashley H.

description: Why are they paving over the historical ruins and cutting down all the trees?  There is a before and after picture to show how the park will look after all the work is finished, but it looks backwards.  I just don't understand.
author: Jay G.

description: This trail may just make me move back to the outer Richmond someday. My absolute favorite place to run in the city. Limited concrete, nice rolling hills, some stairs to work my legs and views of the ocean and GG Bridge.
author: Kelly B.

description: absolutely gorgeous but if you're like me and are deathly afraid of heights, avoid land's end at all costs. otherwise, you will have a panic attack as your family forces you to basically walk along a cliff and you will then sit by a tree that seems sufficiently far away from the edge of said cliff and cry, abandoned by your hiking enthusiast, heights appreciating family.
author: Mairead J.

description: It was New Years Day.  I decided to take a nice long stroll with my roomate Bobby, and his friend Karen.  I walked from one end of the Ocean beach towards the Cliff House.  I ended up in Land's End Trail.  It was a breezy day, but the view is spectacular so I wasn't complaining.  Got to see a lot of surfers on the beach, and once we hike up the trail, There was even better view of the Pacific Ocean.  We walked thru this amazing golf course, and passed thru the Legion of Honor.  We continiued to walk towards the trail, somehow ended up in Seacliff, walked thru this amazing place with all the beautiful expensive houses.  It was so gorgeous looking down, and proceeded to walk towards the Presidio.  I don't know how much walk we did, but we ended up walking up to Golden Gate Bridge.  The view was really magnicent, by that time..,it has been way past noon, and the sun coming thru.  Looking out into the ocean, I saw Alcatraz, and all the seaboats.  Many many tourist in this area, with bikers, and people with Gocars.  It's so pretty up there looking down, makes you don't want to leave and just glaze thru the night, just remember to bring a jacket with you.
author: Jenny W.

description: What a surene place. My favorite escapade. Especially recommend in the mornings.
author: Mark P.

description: 4 stars only because about halfway down the trail where there's a view of the beach someone had made a giant male genitalia in the sand. i'm guessing it was about 40 yards in length. minus 1 star for immature trail users.
author: Nathan S.

description: yet another great park in san francisco. this one raps around the ocean to the bay with awesome views. you can see sea lions, dolphins, sharks, cliffs, cool trees, etc. i'm glad it's open again. a really cool place. also home to the legion of honor
author: Pflip W.

description: Beautiful and perfect for any activity from taking a stroll, hiking,  walking your dog, jogging or even training cross country.  When you've passed the first two lookouts it's off to nature - few people, no pavement, quiet, gorgeous scenery.  It doesn't feel like you're in a major city at all!   If you're looking for a nice running trail, this is it.  Signs can help you identify the right distance loop and then off you go with beautiful views of the ocean, cliffs and Golden Gate Bridge.
author: J R.

description: love this place! "best kept secret" of the SF west side. the pacific ocean/ beach is to the west and the entire trail follows along and into the opening of the bay. gorgeous views of the cliff sides and 'private' views of the golden gate bridge. :-) great for runs, hikes, walks, etc. this is also a great place to start or end from other running routes.
author: Tiffany W.

description: land's end is the best escape from the city within the city.  go here alone.  go here with visitors.  go here with friends.  especially in the summer when the days are long, this is a great place to go running or hiking after work without having to cross the bridge for an escape to nature.
author: Erin C.

description: I am lucky to live only a few blocks from the entrance to this trail. Even though I have walked this trail many times, its beauty still is uplifting.
author: Tyler H.

description: If you haven't been there recently - check out the new trail, benches and the jaw dropping views.  Don't miss the USS San Francisco Memorial.
author: CakeMaker S.

description: This is my favorite little hike in the world.  Anyone who gives this trail less than five stars should jump off the cliff it skirts.
author: Nick K.

description: unbelievable. i've brought every visitor here for years. i've walked this trail a million times and never get tired of it. start on the ocean side--then you get to return to that gorgeous ocean view.
author: Yelp Y.
